job description:
About the job
Norma Doors, el mayor fabricante de puertas a nivel nacional, ubicado en San Leonardo de Yagüe (Soria), busca incorporar a un analista junior de marketing.
Inicialmente, esta persona formará parte del equipo de marketing actual y trabajará de forma conjunta con el departamento comercial. Una vez formada, el objetivo es que lidere el departamento de marketing reportando directamente a dirección comercial.
Responsabilidades que deberá ir adoptando:
Definir las campañas offline y online (con medios propios y externos), coordinar su ejecución y analizar su rendimiento.
Responsable de marketing online, posicionamiento y gestión de redes sociales
Posicionamiento y actualización página web (Wordpress).
Crear presentaciones comerciales, material de ventas (folletos, brochures, argumentarios, etc.) para apoyar al equipo comercial.
Garantizar que los materiales de marketing creativo se sometan a revisiones periódicas y se adhieran a las directrices de la marca.
A nivel internacional definir y ejecutar el marketing plan en función del mercado objetivo.
Imagen corporativa - definir y aplicar la política de marketing
Branding - Generar branded content
Comunicación interna: apoyar y desarrollar la estrategia de comunicación interna
Comunicación institucional y relaciones con partners, medios, asociaciones y patrocinios

Perfil que buscamos:
Formación en: marketing/ publicidad/ periodismo o similar.
Al menos 1 año de experiencia en un departamento de marketing (preferiblemente en el sector de la industria o B2B)
Nivel alto de inglés. Se valorarán otros idiomas especialmente el francés
Conocimiento de Redes sociales, WordPress, SEO, Mailchimp y programas de edición de vídeos. Habilidad en redacción de contenidos.
Perfil con visión estratégica y analítica. Clara vocación comercial y orientación al cliente.
Capacidad de "autoorganizarse" y "autoaprender"

Ofrecemos:
- Contrato laboral indefinido, jornada completa
- Posibilidad de trabajar en un modelo híbrido (60% oficinas – 40% teletrabajo).
- Formar parte de en una empresa consolidada y líder en su sector, con elevado ritmo de crecimiento.
- Proyección de carrera y desarrollo profesional dentro de la empresa.
Otras consideraciones:
- Buscamos alguien que tenga cierta experiencia y resida actualmente en los alrededores de Soria o Burgos (a unos 50 minutos de la planta como máximo) ya que la presencialidad debe ser de al menos el 50%.
- La compensación fija total ofertada se encuentra entre los 20.000€ y los 25.000€ en función de la experiencia previa del candidato, capacidades demostrables, nivel académico, banda salarial actual... En función del punto de partida, se definirá un plan de carrera para ir mejorando condiciones en la medida que adopte responsabilidades
- No nos preocupa la edad de la persona, ni su situación actual en cuanto al empleo (empleada, desempleada, en sabático...)
skills: Para empresas (B2B)

job description:
About the job
DATA SCIENTIST
We are growing our data science team to help Tendam (Cortefiel, Pedro del Hierro, Springfield, women´secret, Fifty, Hoss Intropia, Dash&Stars, Hi&BYE, OOTO y Slow Love) solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Data Scientist for a unique opportunity of impacting the way the world experiences fashion.

What will you do?
1. Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations
2. Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
3. Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
4. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
5. Present information using data visualization techniques

What are we looking for?
1. Scientific background with computational and analytical skills
2. Strong problem solving skills with emphasis on analyzing issues, identifying causes, and recommending solutions quickly
3. Programming skills with Python and SQL
4. Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)
5. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)
6. Experience with cloud based web services (e.g., AWS)
7. Experience working with huge amounts of data
8. Experience with data visualization tools and packages.
9. Strong ability with data-reporting tools such as Excel and building reports (Quicksight, Tableau…)
10. Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git)
11. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
12. Collaborative spirit and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively to both colleagues and stakeholders
13. A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

Extra qualifications
1. Knowledge and/or experience in the fashion retail industry

Why coming to Tendam?
1. One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members
2. Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc
3. Building machine learning models for real world problems: have a real impact in the business!
4. Working with cutting edge technologies
5. Exposure to agile methodologies
6. Working in a challenging and dynamic industry
7. A great team!

UBICACIÓN: oficinas centrales de Madrid (zona norte accesibles en metro, cercanías y autobuses urbanos).
CONTRATO: Indefinido.
Horario: jornada flexible de lunes a jueves de 7:30-9:30h y salida entre 17-19h, viernes jornada intensiva durante todo el año, de 7:30-9:30h y salida entre 13-15h.
Disponemos de comedor de empresa, descuento para empleados y buen ambiente laboral.
skills: Python, Resolución de problemas, SQL, Capacidad de análisis, Microsoft Excel, Metodologías ágiles, and Tableau

job description:
About the job
Kruk España S.L.U, we are a multinational company operating within the financial sector, with headquarters in Poland. In Spain we are specialized in debt recovery, helping our clients offering customized solutions for the resolution of their debt situation.
Now you could be part of KRUK working in our Operational Analysis Section like Data Analyst.
You will analyze and interpret business data using analytics tools to provide insights and insights to help operational area managers make data-based decisions, in order to help achieve the goals.


Main responsibilities:
•Responsible for extracting, grouping, sorting and classifying data in bulk.
•Prepare and interpret raw data using SQL.
•Prepare reports that helps to make strategics decisions.
•Participates in the preparation and analysis of case studies in order to quantify the financial impact of new initiatives for customers.
•Collaborate with international teams to implement assigned projects
•Compiles statistical analyses based on "open source" statistical tools (such as R / Python etc.)"

Position Requirements:

•Tools: experience with SQL, Excel expert, Tableau, statsistical tools -R or Python- good database management.
1-2 years of experiencie in a similar position.
•Knowledge of English - high level to collaborate with international teams.
•Ability to work independently and as a team.
•Analytical thinking

What can we offer you?
Flexible working hours
Teleworking
Social benefits, private health insurance, commuting benefit.
Flexible retribution
skills: Capacidad de análisis, SQL, Python, Inglés, Microsoft Excel, Tableau, and Bases de datos

job description:
About the job
Sobre VISEO:

En VISEO nos diferenciamos por la participación en proyectos innovadores de soluciones Cloud, usando tecnologías como Microsoft, SAP, entre otras. En nuestra unidad de Data Analytics abarcamos una gran diversidad de proyectos y tecnologías, además de trabajar en entornos BIG DATA, o evolucionar hacia áreas de Data Scientist.

Tu Rol:

Formarás parte de un gran equipo de BI con múltiples tecnologías (MSFT, AWS, TABLEAU, SQL, ETC).
Proyectos BI de reporting en todas las áreas (operaciones, marketing, ventas,…), proyectos bigdata, analítica predictiva, ETL’s, mantenimientos, etc.
Tecnologías que utilizamos en el dpto: TABLEAU, SAP ANALYTICS CLOUD, POWER BI, QLIK, BW, SQLSERVER, BIGDATA, S4HANA, AZURE, AWS, ETC.
Aplicación de metodologías agiles.

Tu perfil:

Buscamos perfiles que quieran iniciar su carrera profesional en BI o quieran seguir desarrollándose en esta área, focalizándose en el área de desarrollo - reporting.
Valorable Conocimientos de POWER BI y/o SAC/ TABLEAU o similar
Valorable conocimiento en otras tecnologías Microsoft

Tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades en seguridad dentro de la compañía:

Acceso a la información confidencial relativa al cliente del que es responsable.
Solicitud de medidas / usuarios.
Observancia del cumplimiento de las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas.
skills: Inteligencia empresarial, Analítica de datos, Bases de datos, Analítica, and Microsoft Power BI

job description:
About the job
Data Specialist / BI Analyst

Location: Madrid, Spain

(This role is office based in the Mindray Madrid office Monday to Friday / full time)

Highly Competitive Salary + Excellent Benefits + Career Enhancement

Reporting to National Operations Manager, Spain

Are you a data guru, fluent in Spanish and English (and preferably Mandarin, but not essential!), well versed in BI tools, data analysis, business performance and reporting looking to have immediate impact on a business in exponential growth – if so, we have a newly created opportunity you will love! To achieve our ambitious growth targets, we have fostered a culture of data driven innovation and product development.

Working with our highly successful Spanish team, based in Madrid, you will have outstanding commercial analytical skills, a comprehensive working experience of tools such as Tableau, or similar BI tools and will join our fun, highly professional, experienced team, to truly shape how we use our data to the fullest. This is an opportunity to really drive the success in Spain, so your impact will be significant.

Your Responsibilities

Provide business data analytics and sales analytics reports that allow stakeholders and executives team to make informed decisions
Facilitate the regional management leaders to conduct business reviews and proactive op portunity management that can improve the visibility of sales pipeline
Monitor and report operational KPI’s in HQ for senior management
You lead the review, analysis, and interpretation of sales trends across their applicable modalities for ensuring the delivery of sales and commercial KPIs
Provide support to internal stakeholders on BI functionality and data content within dashboard
Daily maintaining of opportunity management tool (C4C)
Manage user demands and system optimization requirements
Identify innovative workflow efficiencies and propose improvements to enhance data quality and timeliness
Build data management platform for regional business

What are we looking for in you?

Degree level educated in a subject with strong analytics focus
Proven comprehensive experience of BI tools / data analysis tools – Tableau, BI, Visual Basic or similar
Background in a data analysis, commercial data, BI based role
Fluent in Spanish and ENGLISH – both written and spoken
Ideally you will be fluent in Mandarin, this is not a mandatory requirement, but helpful!
Advanced knowledge of MS Office – particularly Excel
Ability work in Spain without the requirement of company sponsorship

What’s in it for you?

This is an excellent position for candidates that are really looking for a role with difference and one in which they can really make an impact. As a double-digit growth business with ambitious targets in our meteoric success, this is an opportunity to join a business built for future success where you can have a true impact on our business, and your own career development!
skills: Analítica de datos, Análisis de datos, Tableau, Analítica, and Inteligencia empresarial

job description:
About the job
🛫 WHO ARE WE ? 🛫

FCM Travel is one of the largest and fastest-growing global business travel management companies with a worldwide reach in almost 100 countries. FCM Lab in Barcelona represents a tribe of more than 110 teammates, united by a single mission: developing and ensuring the best services and technology products to support business travelers in their trips around the globe.

See our video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xXbK-tag0jk&t=133s) to find out who the Product and Dev in the Barcelona team is. Read more about us at www.fcmtravel.com.

🎯 YOUR MISSIONS

As a member of the Data team at the FCM Lab, you will work with other data analysts to deliver qualitative analysis to our internal and external clients.

Your main tasks will be to produce data reports, data visualisation models and develop new analysis on business travel thematics, using various data visualisation tools (Power BI, Azure & Qlik Sense).

You will work with data from various sources (API, webservices, MySQL & PostGreSQL databases….), create reports, deploy & manage databases.

You will work with various departments from the company to answer their data needs, both as a data provider and a data consultant.

As a tech savvy, you will juggle with Python & SQL and data visualisation tools. You will discover and develop new innovative tools.
Database architecture & ETL data pipelines (Azure, PowerBI, Python, SQL)
Development & management of databases (PostgresSQL, MySQL)
Fetching data from API (JSON, XML, custom Webservices)
Ideation & development of KPIs and data dashboards (Power BI, Qlik Sense)
Creation & development of KPIs
Creation & automation of Data reports (internal & external clients)
Ticket & project management with various (nice) internal stakeholders

👀 Our Ideal Candidate ?
Fluent in English (Spanish or French is a plus)
Excellent organisational and problem solving/decision-making skills with keen attention to detail
Critical thinking and problem solving capabilities
Good communication and presentation skills
Experience and demonstrated skills in SQL databases (PostgreSQL) ; strong Python skills required
Experience with Data visualisation tools - PowerBI is a big plus !
You are familiar with the Agile methodologies (Scrum)
Basic knowledge of Git is preferred
Good sense of humour compulsory !

🎁 WHY FCM SPAIN ?

As well as being a fun company to work at, we offer:
Possibility to benefit to a health insurance
25 days off/year* + reduced time during summer + bank holidays
Discounts to access your favorite gym (Andjoy app!)
Free language lessons (English, French, Spanish or Catalan)
The opportunity to work with an international and talented team
Several activities organized by the ambassadors!

Salary according to the profile (from 32K€ up to 43K€)

We truly think personality is important so bring it on!
skills: Bases de datos, SQL, Visualización de datos, Comunicación, Atención al detalle, Python, and Resolución de problemas

job description:
About the job
Somos una organización de asesoramiento global en las áreas de fiscal, legal, laboral, consultoría, auditoria y M&A. Contamos con un equipo de más de 175 profesionales especializados y con una trayectoria de más de 30 años de experiencia.

¿Qué estamos buscando?

Para cubrir nuestra necesidad de crecimiento, deseamos incorporar un Consultor en el área de Business Intelligence con conocimientos en entorno Microsoft Power BI .

Principales Funciones:

Participar en proyectos de definición e implantación de Cuadros de Mando para las distintas áreas de la empresa mediante la utilización de las herramientas Business Intelligence de Microsoft Power BI.
Obtención de datos, análisis y procesamiento de estos.
Analizar y definir estrategia e identificar nuevas oportunidades de negocio.
Comunicación constante con cliente para la toma de requerimientos, validación y soporte en la utilización.

Ofrecemos:

Proyección profesional basada en la continua adquisición de conocimientos y experiencia participando en proyectos en organizaciones de primer nivel.
Entorno y Ambiente de trabajo excelente.
Programas intensivos de capacitación continuada en competencias profesionales propias de la consultoría.


Se precisa:

Formación de Ingeniería, ADE o similar.
3 años de experiencia en Proyectos de Business Intelligence.
Experiencia en MS Power BI, lenguaje DAX, configuración de Data Gateway i funcionalidades de PowerQuery.
Perfil analítico, dinámico y riguroso, acostumbrado a manejar y analizar indicadores de gestión de negocio.
Valorable buen nivel de inglés.
skills: Microsoft Power BI, Inteligencia empresarial, Bases de datos, Analítica de datos, and Comunicación

job description:
About the job
TELUS International is looking for Language Data Analysts in Barcelona, Spain to work onsite for a machine learning project! At the moment, we are looking for candidates with fluency in Danish . For this position, we also offer relocation assistance .

Language Data Analysts will analyze data in a given language and identify potential issues. They will also collaborate with international testing teams and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features. Data obtained will be used to train and improve speech recognition and AI systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Includes, but is not limited to the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Linguistic data labelling.
Analyzing language data in the given language and identifying potential issues and patterns.
Collaborating with an international testing team and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features.
Communicating with various departments.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Fluency in Danish .
Preferred educational background: linguistics, literature or translation.
Available to work onsite in Barcelona, Spain.
Excellent reading, writing and comprehension skills in English; ability to understand and closely follow elaborate guidelines in English.
In-depth knowledge of native culture and history, staying up to date with day-to-day news and happenings in the target country and regular use of the language required.
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet project targets.
Self-motivated and able to work as part of the team or independently.
Good computer and software skills across different operating systems.
Strong typing skills.
Good organizational skills
Adaptable to changing environments.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Attractive salary
Relocation assistance
Permanent, full-time contract with TELUS International
Referral program with attractive bonuses
Private medical insurance for employees and relatives
Great office at a top location
Positive international working environment (relaxing zones, terrace, kitchen)
Discounts in gym memberships
Career development opportunities
No overtime or weekend work
Continuous support and learning
Access to counseling sessions

If this opportunity sounds appealing to you, apply now! Kindly attach your CV in English.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

ABOUT US:

AI Data Solutions

Creating and enhancing the world's data to enable better AI via human intelligence.

We strive to enhance the world's data to enable better AI through human intelligence. Our team of data, technology, and project management professionals work with companies to test and improve machine learning models. We handle various data types, including text, images, audio, video, and geo. Our solutions improve AI systems in multiple applications, such as advanced smart products, improved search results, expanded speech recognition, more human-like bot interactions, and more.

TELUS International values diversity and grants equal opportunity regardless of age, civil status, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion and political beliefs, sex or sexual orientation.

Additional Job Description

TELUS International is looking for Danish Language Data Analysts in Barcelona, Spain.

Language Reference

Danish

EEO Statement

At TELUS International, we enable customer experience innovation through spirited teamwork, agile thinking, and a caring culture that puts customers first. TELUS International is the global arm of TELUS Corporation, one of the largest telecommunications service providers in Canada. We deliver contact center and business process outsourcing (BPO) solutions to some of the world's largest corporations in the consumer electronics, finance, telecommunications and utilities sectors. With global call center delivery capabilities, our multi-shore, multi-language programs offer safe, secure infrastructure, value-based pricing, skills-based resources and exceptional customer service - all backed by TELUS, our multi-billion dollar telecommunications parent.

Equal Opportunity Employer

At TELUS International, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire and promote, are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.
skills: Atención al detalle, Aptitudes de organización, Análisis de datos, Visualización de datos, Inglés, Resolución de problemas, and Capacidad de análisis

job description:
About the job
Role

Our EMEA Data Team is looking for someone who recently finished their studies to do our graduate program in data analysis to process our data across global markets. We are a team of data analysts who have effective relationships with other teams and are committed to deliver the best quality data. You will work closely with the global team, taking responsibility for data coverage, quality, and timeliness to the highest standards. The position will be based in our Data and Development Center EMEA in Madrid.

Responsibilities

Work with our Data Research Analysts on the collection and maintenance of Morningstar data, ensuring high levels of data accuracy, completeness and coverage.

Assist the Data Research Analysts to meet the predetermined production deadlines.

Work as part of our project teams who evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools.

Help analyzing investment data points and calculations, answering questions from other members of the data team.

Organize meetings and support the day to day activities of the Analyst team.

Utilize project management methodologies such as LEAN Six Sigma to track, evaluate and determine resolution approach for complex data issues.

Continuous communication with fund companies and 3rd party Data providers to collect data for our databases.

Requirements

Recently graduated from the bachelor’s degree (maximum 3 years since graduation).

1 year contract length.

Proficient oral and written communication skills. Fluent in English and 2 other European languages (German, French, Dutch, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese)

Solid understanding of the financial industry and passionate about investment data.

Solid analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate large amounts of data with attention to detail and accuracy.

Previous experience in project management and knowledge of Microsoft Office are a plus.
skills: Atención al detalle, Comunicación, Bases de datos, Analítica de datos, Capacidad de análisis, and Visualización de datos

job description:
About the job
En NTT DATA seguimos en proceso de crecimiento y precisamos incorporar un perfil Data Engineer con foco en Data Visualization. Se requiere:

Conocimientos en herramientas de visualización de datos (MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Tableau, Looker) y SQL.
Experiencia demostrable en el diseño y construcción de dashboards.
Conocimiento de datos y herramientas BI.

Se ofrece:
Contrato indefinido.
Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportada.
Plan de Carrera: desarrollo profesional y proyección internacional a tu medida.
Plan de Formación personalizado a nivel profesional y técnico.
Beneficios sociales: Tickets Restaurante, Seguro Médico, Seguro de Vida y de Accidentes.

NTT DATA somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, sector financiero (banca y seguros), industria, utilities, sector público y sanidad.

¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.

Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.

#Greattech needs #GreatPeople like you.
skills: SQL, Visualización de datos, and Tableau

job description:
About the job
¡Estamos buscando un analista técnico PHP, para unirse a nuestro equipo de desarrollo de producto! Como parte de nuestro equipo, tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar en un proyecto único en el sector de las Telecomunicaciones.

Buscamos a alguien que pueda trabajar de manera colaborativa, que tenga una gran atención al detalle y que sea apasionado por su trabajo.

Responsabilidades:
Te incorporarás a nuestro equipo especializado en el diseño y desarrollo de producto:
Diseñando, desarrollando y manteniendo nuestra pila de producto software con base PHP, utilizando frameworks como Symfony o Svelte
Identificando y resolviendo problemas técnicos y proponiendo soluciones innovadoras que garanticen la calidad del producto final.

Requisitos:
Experiencia en programación en PHP, idealmente sobre framework Symfony o Svelte
Experiencia en desarrollo en la nube, preferiblemente en Azure.
Conocimiento de bases de datos relacionales y SQL, idealmente MySQL.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas de control de versiones como Git.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y colaborar con otros desarrolladores.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita.
Ser apasionado por la tecnología y estar al tanto de las últimas tendencias y avances en el área.

Ofrecemos:
Salario competitivo.
Ambiente de trabajo dinámico y creativo.
Oportunidades de crecimiento profesional y de aprendizaje continuo.
Flexibilidad en horarios y trabajo remoto.

Si te apasiona el desarrollo web, tienes experiencia en PHP y desarrollo cloud y estás buscando una oportunidad emocionante para trabajar en un ambiente de colaboración y crecimiento profesional, ¡envíanos tu CV!
skills: SQL and MySQL

job description:
About the job
En Iberostar Group estamos buscando incorporar a un/a Data Analyst a nuestro equipo de Compras en Palma de Mallorca, pero antes de saber más sobre la posición, creemos que es importante que sepas un poco sobre Iberostar Group:

Somos una empresa 100% familiar (Concretamente, una familia de más de 30.000 empleados/as).
Tenemos presencia en 35 países y nuestras oficinas centrales están en Palma de Mallorca.
Nuestros valores son muy importantes para nosotros, todas nuestras acciones van acorde a ellos. (Pasión, Responsabilidad, Transparencia, Creatividad y Humildad).
Somos pioneros en turismo sostenible (Revisa nuestro movimiento Wave of Change para saber más).

Si esto te resulta interesante… puede que este sea tu sitio.


¿Cuál será tu misión?

Serás la persona de referencia para reforzar las capacidades analíticas y de reporting de datos de la Dirección General de Recursos en todo aquello relacionado con la descarbonización de la cadena de suministro y de las operaciones del Grupo Iberostar. Para ello, deberás recoger las necesidades de los departamentos de Compras y de Inversiones y Proyectos y trabajarás en colaboración con el equipo Digital/DATO de la compañía para asegurar la disponibilidad, la usabilidad, la integridad y la visualización de los datos.


¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

Trabajarás con la información existente en los sistemas de información enfocados a la descarbonización de la cadena de suministro y de las operaciones para acelerar la transformación necesaria en las operaciones y desarrollar informes, cuadros de mando y visualizaciones interactivas sobre las plataformas específicas.
Realizarás analíticas descriptivas y analíticas avanzadas para aportar valor a los diferentes equipos y usuarios de negocio, identificar tendencias y anomalías en los datos, y reportar las correspondientes incidencias para su resolución.
Trabajarás con otros miembros de la unidad en el DATO (Data Analytics & Transformation Office), la integración, transformación y el modelado de datos.
Colaborarás con el departamento de DIGITAL para programar y configurar protocolos de extracción/envío de datos de/a plataformas de terceros.
Llevarás a cabo reuniones con diferentes interlocutores para comprender los objetivos y alcance de los proyectos e iniciativas así como registrarlas en la Gestión de Proyectos y la Gestión de Ticketing de la compañía según su tipología.
Colaborarás en los proyectos del departamento y responsabilizarse de ciertas tareas dando soporte a los Project Managers proporcionando orientación a los usuarios, revisando alcances y requisitos, realizando QA y evaluaciones de rendimiento, etc.
Colaborarás y resolverás solicitudes de la gestión de servicios.
Analizarás los procesos de negocio y determinarás cómo se pueden cambiar y/o mejorar los resultados.
Realizarás escenarios “what-if”.


¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Formación:
IT Programación - Ingeniería Industrial.
Preferiblemente Máster en análisis de datos.
Desenvolverse en Inglés sin dificultades a nivel oral y escrito.
Valorable Francés.

Conocimientos Específicos:
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas de BI (especialmente SAP Business Objects y/o PowerBI).
Conocimiento de datos estructurados, como entidades, clases, jerarquías, relaciones y metadatos.
Conocimientos en Web Services, APIs, SSIS, BBDDs SQL y/o Oracle.
Valorable conocimientos y servicios de los Clouds AZURE y/o GCP.
Conocimientos y experiencia con la programación de protocolos para el envío de datos.

Trayectoria y Experiencia:
Experiencia mínima de 2-3 años en un rol similar.



¿Qué beneficios tendrás?

Un paquete de atractivos beneficios como: descuentos en todos nuestros hoteles y en otros servicios y productos como seguro de salud, viajes, ocio y mucho más; ser miembro de la Comunidad Iberostar Vitality (nuestro programa de empresa saludable y de bienestar para el empleado que incluye clases de yoga semanales, gimnasio virtual, planes nutricionales, día de la fruta, etc. ).
Smart Working: Flexibilidad horaria y posibilidad de teletrabajo.
Oportunidad de progresión dentro de la compañía: variedad de oportunidades y proyectos que te permitirán desarrollar tu potencial y crecer profesionalmente todos los días, además de poder acceder a nuestro Campus Elearning desde tu primer día.

job description:
About the job
Do you live in Spain and want to earn extra income?

Peroptyx is a provider of data and evaluation solutions used by global technology and financial enterprises to build the most locally relevant, safest and intuitive online services for their customers.

We are currently looking for freelance / independent contractors to join our community of Data Analyst in Map Applications. This role offers flexible opportunities with competitive rates. The position will allow you to work from home with a schedule that minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Data Analyst in Map Applications, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you! We are currently looking for freelancers as
Data Analyst - Map Evaluator (home office)
Part-time position, freelancer/self-employed basis, home office

The Role
· You will complete tasks related to online maps and route planning for Spain.
· You will classify/evaluate the data in relation to these tasks.
· You will use online tools to examine the accuracy of geographic queries, addresses and routes.
· To qualify for this position, you will first need to successfully complete an online entrance exam.

Ideal Candidate
Fluent in Spanish and English.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Spain
Analytical mindset.
Job Requirements
Must be living in Spain for the last 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
All products will be provided at your own expense
Only one member per household may apply
Benefits
Work up to 20 hours per week. #homeoffice #nationwide #backtowork #
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
Are you looking for flexible working hours? Would a second income or rewarding experience come in handy as a career booster? Then apply now!

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.
skills: Análisis de datos, Analítica de datos, Capacidad de análisis, Analítica, and SQL

job description:
About the job
JR0114179

Data Analysis - Product Performance Associate ) – Madrid, Spain

Are you ready to play a pivotal role using your analytical skills to ensure growth and success across our Financial Ecosystem in Europe? Do you have a passion for innovation and for using data to drive commercial success? If so, why not consider joining Western Unions’ new Digital Banking hub as a Data Analysis - Product Performance Associate .

Western Union powers your pursuit.

In this unique role for the new pan-European Ecosystem you will play a critical role in ensuring the success of our digital banking product by tracking and analyzing performance metrics, identifying trends and opportunities for improvement, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive product optimization.

Role Responsibilities
Using a wide range of data, you will be identifying trends and insights to inform product optimization and growth strategies.
You will collaborate with Product Management Team to establish performance metrics and KPIs for our digital banking product.
You will work with cross-functional teams, including product, marketing, and technology, to identify and prioritize product improvements and enhancements.
You will conduct market research and competitor analysis to stay up to date with industry trends and best practices.
You will communicate product performance insights and recommendations to key stakeholders and partners, and you will have an active role in the product reporting cycles.
Role Requirements
For this important role you will have 5+ years of professional experience in data analysis, performance analysis or a related field, although candidates with other relevant experience will be considered.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience using data to inform decision-making.
You have excellent communication and collaboration skills and the ability to work independently and in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
=
You demonstrate experience with mobile and web tools, and experience in digital banking propositions, market trends, and the competitve landscape.
A strong academic background including qualifications (or equivalence in experience) in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing or Technology, or a related field is advantageous.
Excellent written and spoken English and Spanish are essential and all other language skills are welcomed.
We make financial services accessible to humans everywhere. Join us for what’s next.

Western Union is positioned to become the world’s most accessible financial services company —transforming lives and communities. To support this, we have launched a Digital Banking Service and Wallet across several European markets to enhance our customers’ experiences by offering a state-of-the-art digital Ecosystem. More than moving money, we design easy-to-use products and services for our digital and physical financial ecosystem that help our customers move forward.

Just as we help our global customers prosper, we support our employees in achieving their professional aspirations. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as receive a great compensation package. If you’re ready to help drive the future of financial services, it’s time for Western Union. Learn more about our purpose and people at https://careers.westernunion.com/

Benefits

You will also have access to short-term incentives, multiple health insurance options, accident and life insurance, and access to best-in-class development platforms, to name a few

(https://careers.westernunion.com/global-benefits/). Please see the location-specific benefits below and note that your Recruiter may share additional role-specific benefits during your interview process or in an offer of employment.

Your Spain Specific Benefits Include
25 days annual leave – plus 14 public holidays
Comprehensive life & medical cover – including dependents.
Contributory pension plan
Preventative Care Assistance program
We are passionate about diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, following applicable laws.

job description:
About the job
Locaria blends insight, data, talent and technology to take global content further for ambitious brands.

We are a pioneering multilingual content activation agency which specializes in supporting marketing and e-commerce teams, media agencies and creative production houses. We are central to the global content solution of Stagwell, the challenger advertising network.

Home to the Association of Translation Companies' Innovator of the Year
Shortlisted for three business awards by The Drum
Named "Best Workplace for Training & Personal Development" by Adaptive
Every day we celebrate the power of amazing content to engage global audiences. At the heart of this is our diverse global team across ten offices, who believe in our vision that content is an indispensable, strategic service. At the heart of our collaborative culture are our values, which inform everything we do.

If you love great content, understand the importance of local language and culture, and want to be part of a dynamic team, then this is the place for you.

The Role

We are looking for Junior Data Scientist to join our team and assist in the development and implementation of data-driven solutions. The successful candidate will have a strong foundation in statistics and programming and be proficient in R and Python. Additionally, this person will have experience with SQL (specifically AWS Athena / Presto), GitHub (CI/CD), time series forecasting and statistical modelling.

The Junior Data Scientist will work alongside our Data Team to help develop, maintain and analyse our data infrastructure.

Key responsabilities

Develop and maintain statistical models for data analysis and forecasting
Collaborate with senior data scientists to implement data-driven solutions
Assist in the development of data infrastructure, including data processing, cleaning, and management
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and support business initiatives with data-driven insights
Develop and maintain data visualisations to communicate insights to stakeholders
Utilise GitHub for version control, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Deployment (CD)
Collaborate with other teams to gather requirements and ensure data quality and accuracy
Conduct thorough statistical analysis and generate reports to support data-driven decision making
Continuously monitor, maintain, and improve existing data processes and models


Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science or equivalent practical experience
Strong proficiency in R and Python programming languages
Experience working with SQL and familiarity with AWS Athena / Presto
Knowledge of Digital Marketing
Client-facing experience showcasing data science projects
Experience with GitHub, specifically version control, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Deployment (CD)
Strong foundation in statistics and statistical modelling, including time series forecasting
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Preferred skills

Experience with machine learning techniques and algorithms
Experience with data visualisation tools.
Knowledge of data governance and security best practices
Some degree of Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP
Share our values

We take content further
We grow together
Celebrating Individuality
Doing good along the way
With care
D&I statement

Locaria is global by nature and vastly strengthened by multicultural, international and eclectic teams. Working together to achieve shared goals, our employees recognise the importance of our core value ‘celebrating individuality', and are supported by Locaria's breadth of cultural resources and insights that attract and retain the best talent.

We appreciate the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings to our team and are fully committed to ensuring equal opportunities across the board, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let our team know.

Join our team and become part of a vibrant workplace and company culture that values and celebrates individuality!#



Benefits

In return for your enthusiasm and expertise, we can offer an exciting and multicultural place of work, competitive salary, wide range of benefits, and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.


Some of these benefits include:

Holiday: You will be entitled to 22 working days paid leave per year (pro-rata in first year), excluding public holidays.
Flexible Working: Opportunities to work from home up to 3 days a week through our Flexible Working Policy, and to work from anywhere as part of our Abroad Working Policy.
Refer a Friend Scheme: We're always on the lookout for talented people. If you refer a friend who is then hired, we will award you with a bonus of up to 2,000 Euros depending on the level of the role being recruited for.
Birthday Day Off: As a gift from us you will receive an extra day off for your birthday each year. If your birthday falls on a weekend, then you can take this the Friday before or Monday after.
Rest and recharge: The option to lengthen your standard 1 hour lunch break by 30 minutes, as long as you maintain the same number of hours you work a day.
Time off to volunteer: In line with our 'Doing Some Good Along The Way' value, all employees are entitled to up to 2 days off a year to get involved in charity initiatives.
Annual Wellbeing and Learning & Development Calendars: We promote a healthy working environment with a focus on growth, which is why we have a calendar with dedicated Wellbeing and Learning & Development sessions and initiatives throughout the year
Equipment: You will be equipped with a laptop, extra screen, mouse and keyboard.

Desired Skills and Experience
Analyst
Data scientist
Junior Data Scientist
skills: Visualización de datos, Analítica de datos, and Comunicación

job description:
About the job
We are looking for a highly skilled Business Data Analyst who is experienced with anticipating and detecting issues with data, with strong experience in SQL to ensure harmonisation of data ingestion and data consistency within their platform. This role is partnered with one of our top global pharmaceutical companies in Spain.

Responsibilities:

Ensure data ingestion harmonization across the different analytical platforms, starting with Adobe Campaign and Adobe Analytics datasets
Check data integrity and consistency and will make the level of matching among environments as visible as needed to users, stakeholders and partners via scoring and reporting
Address every detected issue to the indicated teams and follow-up the resolution
Support regions understanding their demands or issues and figuring out the best possible solution according to scalability and simplicity principles
Contact Focus Areas owners and Adobe platform managers in order to anticipate potential impacts among the different platforms due to evolutions or maintenance tasks


And the desired skills are:

Mind-structured and methodic in order to detect any potential issue whatever the stage is
+4 years using SQL, +1 year using Python or R
Deep knowledge around data reading techniques on AWS cloud and SnowFlake with large volumes of data
Strong experience on the business side, not a developer role
Previous experience deploying similar solutions covering data quality checks and integrity
Familiar with other relational DBMS like Oracle, SQL Server and data modeling strategies like star schema or vault
Capacity to influence providers, partners or stakeholders without authority
Previous knowledge around Adobe solutions like Campaign or Analytics will be highly valued
Good communication skills
Fluent English

If you are a self-motivated individual who is passionate about data analytics, we want to hear from you. Please submit your application today to join our team and help us maintain the highest standards of data analytics in the pharmaceutical industry.

If you have the skills and experience for this opportunity, then please apply or email Loren your CV today to loren.cardy@hayburysearch.com.

Loren is a Client Partner at Haybury Search covering Europe, UK, North America and Asia.
skills: Python, Inglés, SQL, Comunicación, and Analítica de datos

job description:
About the job
Data2Diamond
Somos un equipo de expertos en analítica de datos, impulsados por la pasión de construir soluciones de análisis de negocios de vanguardia. Ayudamos a los responsables de la toma de decisiones, a entender y analizar sus datos para hacer llevar su negocio al siguiente nivel. Hemos entregado soluciones en toda Europa y EE.UU. para múltiples industrias como la aviación comercial, el comercio minorista, las finanzas y los seguros.

Acerca del puesto de trabajo
Actualmente, estamos buscando un (Ella/El/Elle) Data Analyst Tableau que participará en las iniciativas de Business Analytics, incluyendo la recopilación de requisitos, análisis exploratorios, visualización de datos y storytelling para presentar los insights a los usuarios finales.

Lo que harás
Extraer datos de fuentes primarias y secundarias, evaluar la calidad y el significado de los datos, traducir los datos a un formato legible. Utilizar herramientas estadísticas para identificar, analizar e interpretar patrones y tendencias en conjuntos de datos complejos que podrían ser útiles para el diagnóstico y la predicción.
Colaborar con desarrolladores de ETL, desarrolladores de inteligencia empresarial, científicos de datos y líderes de alto nivel para identificar oportunidades de mejora de procesos, proponer modificaciones del sistema y diseñar estrategias de gobernanza de datos para incorporar las mejores prácticas.
Realizar análisis exploratorios de datos y examinar los datos para reconocer e identificar patrones. Utilizar técnicas de modelación de datos para crear resúmenes y observaciones clave para líneas de servicio funcionales, por ejemplo, arquitectura de datos, gobernanza de datos, inteligencia empresarial y ciencia de datos.
Colaborar con el equipo de Data Science para obtener datos externos e introducirlos en el entorno de desarrollo de ciencia de datos.
Participar en múltiples proyectos interdepartamentales, establecer relaciones de trabajo eficaces con los grupos de clientes asignados para obtener resultados empresariales.

Lo que buscamos
Actitud positiva con una gran pasión por aprender y siempre estar abierto a nuevos retos.
Licenciatura en Informática, Sistemas de Información, Administración de Empresas, Finanzas, Sistemas de Información de Gestión, Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería, Estadística, Economía, y / o campo relacionado.
Mínimo 2 años en Análisis y Visualización de Datos.
Experiencia y conocimientos intermedios de programación SQL y Python.
Experiencia y conocimientos intermedios de herramientas de Business Intelligence (Preferiblemente Tableau, pero también se valorará experiencia en otras herramientas como Qlik, PowerBI).
Nivel avanzado de inglés.

Qué ofrecemos:
Sueldo competitivo.
Horario de trabajo flexible.
Programa de aprendizaje continuo.
Increíbles eventos de Team building.
Remuneración flexible: tickets de restaurante, tickets de transporte.
skills: Tableau, Análisis de datos, Analítica de datos, Capacidad de análisis, and SQL

job description:
About the job
Who We Are:
AKDM is a leader in delivering digital growth strategies guided by data, analytics, and business intelligence. We work with a range of clients — spanning niche players to industry leaders across e-commerce, financial services, travel, entertainment, and consumer packaged goods.

Inclusivity for our teams is a priority. From DEI training to volunteering, we are on a journey to connect our business goals with values by promoting a culture of equity and access. We are actively seeking candidates that bring diverse perspectives to our team and work with us to build better, more inclusive approaches to work and collaboration.

About the Role:
As a Web Analyst, designing and implementing tracking solutions doesn’t intimidate you. You thrive in this role when you’re able to track across a wide variety of platforms, collaborate with teams across disciplines, and help establish a data-driven culture of measurement. Your passion for figuring out better ways to track key user actions that directly impact ROI provides the basis for many crucial downstream processes; complex analysis, data products, and measurement of digital marketing performance.


Responsibilities:
Develop measurement best practices and technology requirements to generate high quality, easily-understood implementation guides for deployments of analytics implementations.
Partner with client engineering teams to audit analytics implementations, troubleshoot tracking issues, and define quality assurance tests to optimize reporting effectiveness.
Collaborate closely with AKDM’s digital marketing teams to enhance tracking capabilities and ensure that data is accurately tracked through all pipelines and reporting endpoints.
Serve as the resource for setting up new analytics implementations, defining how they are similar, and how they are radically different to internal and external teams.
Actively focus on the future-proofing, scalability, and ease of maintenance in all analytics implementations.
Maintain a repository of high quality technical deliverables, methodologies and business development documents.
Stay up to date with industry trends (such as iOS14 and server-side tagging) within the analytics space.

Competencies:
Undergraduate degree or any equivalent combination of education and experience.
1-2 years of analytics implementation with an understanding of the digital marketing or ad tech space (i.e. attribution models, feed based marketing, pixel based marketing).
Comprehensive knowledge of JavaScript and an understanding of popular libraries and frameworks to enhance analytics deployment.
Understanding of common data layer methodology, designing a cohesive data model (data layer) and interpreting a solution design document.
Extensive experience with analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and Amplitude.
Extensive experience with marketing and advertising engines such as Facebook, Google (Ads, CM360, SA360), Bing, Tiktok, Pinterest, Snapchat, Twitter, Reddit, and Criteo.
Extensive experience with tag management systems such as Google Tag Manager, Tealium, or Dynamic Tag Management.
Familiarity with deploying and testing analytics tools in mobile apps for iOS and Android devices, especially using the Firebase SDK.
Proven critical thinking, analytical problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to bridge the gap between technology and business management.
Familiarity with web technologies and website infrastructure (data layers, HTTP protocol, DevTools, cookies, client/server interactions, asynchronous website, etc..).
Ready to be part of a tight-knit, growing team; ambitious, can work independently as well as collaboratively and possess interpersonal skills.

Nice to Haves:
Experience with front-end development, including customizing templates for popular content management platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, Magento, Drupal, and more.
Experience with one or more data visualization tools, including Tableau, PowerBI, or Data Studio.
You love to figure out ways to automate work processes and have some familiarity with SQL.
Experience working in a startup environment with exceptional multi-tasking and context-switching capabilities.

What We Provide For Spain Employees:
Funded Pension Plan
30 calendar days for PTO
13th & 14th month salary
Holidays: We observe all major Spain holidays and encourage our employees to celebrate their cultural and ethnic traditions without having to take PTO
Paid Parental Leave: We provide 16 weeks paid leave for primary caregivers
Mentorship Program: Mentees receive one-on-one support from the leadership team to receive practical advice and guidance in developing future career goals
Flexible work from home policy


What We Value:
At AKDM we believe diversity is essential to crafting digital strategies. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin of employees, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.
skills: SQL and Resolución de problemas

job description:
About the job
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times , some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do

Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units

Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 3 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau
Good knowledge of Python is a plus
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas

Why should you join Proton?

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world’s top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

job description:
About the job
TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. Accommodation Sourcing is a global team within TUI technology responsible for the connectivity and sourcing of hotel and accommodation portfolio. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.

At TUI we’re ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.


We never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.


The Business Analyst is a critical thinker with a keen eye for detail. Actively consulting with stakeholders, probing to create and communicate a common understanding of the problem that needs solving. Working within a fast-paced agile environment, the Business Analyst thinks outside of the box, loves collaborating across teams and is a lifelong learner.

The Business Analyst in the supplier connectivity environment is a primarily a technical role. A general technical understanding of data exchange via APIs is required as well as reading and working with technical data exchange formats. The specification and design of data models and the data flow between different micro services as well as the mapping of business-related data is one of the core tasks for the Business Analyst.

ABOUT THE JOB:

As a Business Analyst, you are part of a cross-functional team that delivers micro service driven backend solutions from conception to operation. You will collaborate with business analysts, software developers, architects, stakeholder, business partners and tech experts to clearly define, document and communicate requirements that will enable implementation of new changes and enhancements to our digital platforms in an agile manner.

You’re responsible for evaluating solution options, consulting with stakeholders as needed to define and articulate business needs in a way that enables the design and delivery of technical solutions that add value across TUI global platforms and services. You use your deep understanding of TUI products and systems, business models, processes, data flows and their link to business capabilities to plan and deliver high quality business analysis that supports the ongoing delivery of growth and digital transformation across our key markets.

Working alongside a varied set of technology and business stakeholders, you define and document new business, user, and system requirements, considering impacts to upstream/ downstream services. You manage the requirement lifecycle from planning through to elicitation, testing, delivery, and business acceptance. You can provide business analysis to multiple scrum-oriented delivery teams and work closely with the technology lead to prioritise and manage complex backlogs.

As a Business Analyst you distil the needs of business and using your strong collaboration skills you support your team to deliver the best solutions to our customers’ needs. You are commercially astute, focusing on solving business problems in the best way.

You love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for excellence, ownership and self-organisation at team and personal level.  You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas. You’re an active member in the Business Analyst community.

Security is part of everyone’s job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.

ABOUT YOU:

Strong analytical skills and commercial acumen. Adept at understanding complex problems and communicating findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Collaborative approach, able to balance the needs of multiple stakeholders and facilitate agreement across multiple markets in a global structure
Proficient at using requirements elicitation methods including business process modelling (BPM), UML, test/use cases and prototyping
Experience creating, analysing and validating detailed functional specifications and elements of systems design; including data rules, data models, data flow processes, business rules, wireframes or other detailed deliverables that articulate how a business need should be satisfied
Good track record of successfully using requirements elicitation and communication techniques including workshop facilitation, documentation analysis, interviewing and brainstorming
Good Knowledge of technical data exchange formats like JSON, XML and YAML
Experience with technical API-technologies like REST and SOAP and corresponding tools like Postman
Knowledge of touristic data formats like EDF and OTA would be helpful
Familiar with database queries (SQL), micro service architecture and AWS services
Demonstrable experience of creating user stories, epics and acceptance criteria/scenarios within a scrum-oriented environment
A good understanding of agile and flexible software delivery methodology, tools and techniques and the software development lifecycle including knowledge of Scrum and Kanban
Customer centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services
Passionate about continuous improvement
Open minded, inquisitive, life-long learner
Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous

About Our Offer

Competitive salary
Pension scheme and life assurance
Generous holiday entitlement & holiday discounts
Forward thinking ways of working
TUI time off, purchase of additional holiday entitlement
Excellent rates with foreign exchange and discounts with retailers

We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA

If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email recruitment@tui.co.uk
skills: Modelado de procesos, Procesos de negocio, Facilitación de talleres, Diseño de procesos empresariales, Reglas de empresa, Especificaciones funcionales, Historias de usuarios, Educción de requisitos, Obtención de requisitos, and API de Postman

position: Mid Data Analyst/Engineer at Factorial HR
job description:
About the job
Hi there 👋

As Factorial continues on our mission of boosting the next generation of people-first SMB's, we're hiring a mid level Data Analyst Engineer to help.

The Team and you

Factorial's mission is to empower businesses to make better decisions, and data is a key component in doing so.

You’ll be part of two teams:
the Data team as they are your peers,
The Core domain: you will bring your data engineering & analysis expertise to that product vertical in particular, specialising in those business questions.

Data engineers are responsible of unlocking communication between the different areas despite the technological stack by offering a self-service platform that allows fast data-driven products. We act under the data mesh principle and we're not afraid to build whatever is necessary to fulfil our partner team's needs. Our data platform is already offering the following services:
Ingestion (SaaS APIs, DDBBs, Streams)
Storage (Data Lake, Stream Storage)
Catalogue (Atlan)
Modeling (Metabolic)
Activation (Hightouch)
Exploration & Visualization (Preset)
On-demand Data Products (TinyBird)

We're looking for Data Engineers to enable the product and engineering team to use these and future services, and to assist them in making data a first-class citizen.

The Role

At Factorial, we have a team of +150 very talented developers. We are looking for engineers who can wear many hats, abstract problems, and find creative solutions. We look for smart people who are curious, proactive and have good soft/communication skills.

We are not looking for a long list of skills and technologies. Our web stack is Ruby on Rails for the backend and React/React-native for the clients, and we interact with Data through SQL on AWS, but it's not mandatory to be proficient in those (most of the team came with other areas of expertise which is very enriching). We believe that someone who has good aptitudes and is hungry for learning is what works best.

If you're looking for new challenges in a people-first company no matter where you live, this is what to expect:
You will evangelise the use of our Data Platform among technical users and empower the creation of Factorial's next Data Products.
You will help stakeholders analyse their data: as you grow more comfortable in the business domain, you will be able to ask the right questions as well as craft the queries to answer them.
You will listen, identify and evaluate new requirements from Stakeholders (Engineering, Product, Management, Sales, Customer Experience, Marketing, Growth).
You will occasionally contribute in managing the platform from a DataOps point of view.

Your profile
You are a team player: You are comfortable helping your teammates, sharing your knowledge, reviewing their code and asking for reviews of your own.
You have a user-centric mindset: You know that the only reason we write code is to help the users of Factorial to perform their tasks.
You like relaxed and fun environments: We work hard and we are committed to Factorial users but we do that in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. We don't take ourselves too seriously.
You are a learner: You want to improve your skills not only in the engineering field but across any other areas.
You are an owner: You like proposing new hypotheses and be responsible for building, deploying and validating them.
You love understanding: Breaking down complex problems into basic and shareable elements and you have evolved concrete implementations to abstractions before.
You are a polyglot developer: You have experience in several coding languages, CI/CD tools and cloud technologies.
You are a mentor: You love to share your experience and expertise to help others grow.
You are comfortable communicating in English.

Your background
Experience in building a modern Data Platforms
Functional programming in Scala (or any other JVM language).
Spark development, especially Structured Streaming, or equivalent (Flink, Beam, Samza,...)
Hands-on with Kafka.

Nice-to-haves:
Knowledge of the AWS Analytics Stack (Glue, S3, Athena, Redshift, Kinesis, Lake Formation)
Advanced Analytical SQL knowledge.
Some alternative coding experience, ideally with a background of web development.
Some infrastructure as code experience, ideally with Terraform on Cloud
GitOps driven mentality and data CI/CD ideas.

At Factorial we don't evaluate you by the years of experience you have, we evaluate your knowledge and skills.

How are we doing it? We have a Career Path with a rubric framework where we define what is expected for each experience level and skill we're evaluating. This framework will allow you to know at which level you're right now and what do you need to continue growing in the company.

As we care deeply about transparency (it's one of our hiring values), our Career Path includes the salaries for each level and we share it during the first interview to make sure we're aligned.

We're a remote-first engineering team company so you can apply from anywhere in the world and English is our official language so this is the only one you need to succeed at Factorial!

To wrap up:

We're looking for a mid-level Data Analyst Engineer.

The compensation is split: 38,250€ base + 4,250€ variable paid monthly, depending on the company’s goals.+ ESOP, regardless of your location

You will also benefit from a 1.000€ yearly Learning and Development budget for books, conferences or workshops that will help you grow.

We bring you a safe and diverse environment to grow and make an impact.

If you’re out of Spain, you will be employed via SafeGuard Global.

Is this you?! Come rock the world with us! 🚀 We #betonpeople 💜

If you don't match everything in this description, we still want to hear from you! There is space to grow in this role, as long as you're curious and eager to learn.

About Factorial HR 🤓

We just raised a $ 120M Series C to keep providing organisations around the globe with the best tools, information and knowledge to help their people succeed.

Factorial is an all-in-one HR Software fast-growing startup founded 6 years ago. Our mission is to help small and medium companies automate HR workflows, centralise people data and make better business decisions. We Currently serve thousands of customers in over 60 countries all over the world and across industries, and have built a diverse and multicultural team of over +800 people in Barcelona, Brazil, Mexico and EEUU offices as well as remotely.

job description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance English and Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English and Spanish
You must be living in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Spain
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community

job description:
About the job
¿Tienes experiencia con Excel y en el análisis de datos, para poder ofrecer asesoramiento a empresas en la mejora de sus procesos? ¡Este puesto te puede interesar!

Trabajarás en una empresa de Artes Gráficas ubicada en la zona del Baix Llobregat y te encargarás de analizar datos relacionados con medidas de embalaje con el objetivo de reducir la cantidad actual.

Necesitamos que seas una persona con capacidad analítica y pensamiento estratégico.

Nivel avanzado de Excel.

Valorable experiencia en packaging o sector artes gráficas.

Ofrecemos un contrato temporal relacionado con este proyecto en concreto, duración inicial de 3 meses con posible ampliación.

Horario a media jornada y con total flexibilidad (mañana o tarde) en función de tu disponibilidad, siempre dentro de un horario de oficina.

About the job
LogiRAIL está acometiendo la definición y puesta en marcha de varios Centros de Competencias Digitales (CCD) en varias ciudades de España. Buscamos el mejor talento para incorporarse a nuestra oficina de Madrid.
