position: Customer Insights Analyst (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
job description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It’s Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

job description:
About the job
Somos un grupo energético multinacional e innovador, presente en más de 20 países. Nos dedicamos a la generación, distribución y comercialización de energía y servicios, comprometidos con el bienestar de las personas, el progreso de empresas y sociedad, y la sostenibilidad del planeta.

El negocio de Comercialización desafía el reto del crecimiento; despuntando en competitividad, reinventando la relación con el cliente, acelerando la digitalización y la generación distribuida para impulsar la energía renovable.
Necesitamos personas de acción, con ganas de aprender, sin miedo y con entusiasmo para evolucionar mirando al futuro.

¡Queremos ser los mejores en lo que hacemos! Trabajando en equipo, haciendo más con menos y desarrollando a cada persona, para crecer juntos tanto en el ámbito comercial como en el de otros negocios, gracias a las oportunidades de movilidad interna del grupo Naturgy.
¿Te apuntas al desafío?
En este contexto buscamos talento para la posición de Data Analyst Sector Energético
Como Data Analyst Sector Energético serás parte de este reto ilusionante donde los datos están en la base de las decisiones de negocio orientadas a la consecución de los objetivos estratégicos de la compañía, en diversos ámbitos de la comercialización de energía y servicios energéticos.
Los retos de tu día a día estarán orientados a:
Desarrollo y generación de procesos ETL para la carga y transformación de la información origen, permitiendo la creación de informes.
Realización de análisis avanzados que faciliten la toma de decisiones, desde la propuesta de requerimientos hasta la presentación de resultados.
Identificación y generación de variables sintéticas asegurando la coherencia en las extracciones entre las diferentes fuentes de información de la compañía.
Automatización de procesos con herramientas de perfil DevOps (AWS Lambdas, Azure Functions ,Git, Athena, …).
Utilización de herramientas de query/reporting, creación de informes y consultas a bases de datos con SAS, SQL, Power BI, QuickSight.
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos predictivos y su explotación en entornos cloud para su consumo (Sagemaker AWS, Glue Jobs,..).
Lo que necesitas:
Requisitos Obligatorios
Titulación: Grado superior en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Ingeniería, ADE, Física o Física Aplicada.
Tener conocimiento de lenguaje de programación orientadas a BBDD (SQL, PL-SQL, SAS) y para análisis estadísticos (Python, SAS, R).
Habilidades obligatorias en herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, QuickSight).
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en análisis de data.
Habilidades para la comunicación y presentación de datos de manera efectiva, para que los análisis puedan ser comprendidos y utilizados por personas que no son expertas en datos. Esto incluye diseñas informes y dashboards en equipo con otros departamentos de la empresa.
Idiomas: Inglés (mínimo C1).
Requisitos Valorables
Conocimiento del sector energético
Experiencia en proyectos con tecnología Cloud (Azure, AWS).
Valorable un segundo idioma.
Lo que ofrecemos
Trabajar en un equipo colaborativo y multidisciplinar.
Ambiente que promueve la diversidad e igualdad.
Programa formativo y de desarrollo.
Compromiso con la conciliación y la flexibilidad, con formato de trabajo híbrido.
Espíritu innovador en un entorno retador y motivador.
Networking y trabajo en equipo con ubicación en Madrid.
¿Te apuntas al desafío?
1) Rellena el formulario con tus datos. Para completar el perfil, te recomendamos adjuntar tu CV actualizado y certificado de inglés.
2) Si cumples el perfil contactaremos contigo para participar en las diferentes pruebas y entrevistas.
3) Si avanzas con éxito en el proceso ¡te damos la bienvenida al equipo Naturgy!

¡Inscríbete y atrévete a impulsar tu energía y acelerar tu futuro con Naturgy!

job description:
About the job
More digital. More human. More Minsait.

Somos una empresa líder global de tecnología y consultoría digital que conecta personas, tecnología y negocios para generar crecimiento, transformación e impacto positivo y sostenible.
Buscamos profesionales con experiencia en ciencia de datos para formar parte de nuestra unidad Data&Analytics con ganas de trabajar en nuestros equipos multidisciplinares.

¿Cuál es el reto que te proponemos?
Trabajarás en proyecto de ciencia de datos.
Estarás en contacto continuo con las novedades tecnológicas, impulsando la transformación digital.
Participarás en proyectos y desarrollos que tienen una alta visibilidad y que marcan la diferencia con soluciones disruptivas y especializadas para toda la cadena de valor.

¿Qué esperamos por tu parte?
Grado en Informática, Matemática, Ingeniería o similar.
Deseable máster en Matemáticas, Estadística, Econometría, Informática o campo relacionado.
Experiencia con R o Python, SQL, Git y otras tecnologías relevantes para realizar análisis estadísticos complejos de datos y modelos de aprendizaje automático.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de sistemas productivos de aprendizaje automático, evaluación y monitorización de modelos.

Capacidades:
Comunicación: proactividad y claridad de sintetizar y presentar ideas
Pensamiento analítico

Motivos por los que te encantará ser un #Minsaiter:
Conciliación y equilibrio: 32 días laborables de descanso, jornada intensiva en verano y teletrabajo.
Carrera profesional y formación continua adaptada a tus necesidades y motivaciones.
Contrato indefinido y retribución competitiva, seguro de vida y acceso a planes de retribución flexible.
Programa de bienestar con acceso a una red de gimnasios, servicio de telemedicina en línea gratuita y otras ventajas.

Minsait, technology for a more human future!
Nuestro compromiso es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

job description:
About the job
excelia es una firma multinacional de Consultoría, Tecnología y Servicios profesionales con más de 20 años de experiencia. Prestamos servicio en más de 50 países de Europa, América Latina y Estados Unidos desde nuestras 10 oficinas propias.

👉 Buscamos una persona para desempeñar el rol de Desarrollador Junior Power BI que esté preparado/a para trabajar en un equipo diverso, que le gusten los retos, altamente motivado/a y colaborativo.

🕵🏽‍♀️ ¿Qué experiencia necesitamos?
2-3 años de experiencia en desarrollos de Visualización Avanzada en Power BI
Manejo de herramientas de integración - SSIS - Visual studio Plataformas DatawareHouse (DWH)
Experiencia del ciclo de vida del dato para la construcción de informes; desde la extracción e ingesta, transformación, y carga de la misma sobre una amplia variedad de almacenes de datos usando SQL.
Manejo de procesos ETL con:
*SQL SERVER, SSIS, SSAS y SSRS
*Azure Data Factory
Conocimientos de Cloud (Azure, AWS...)

📝 Se valorará conocimientos técnicos en:

job description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance English and Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English and Spanish
You must be living in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Spain
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community

job description:
About the job
SumUp is a digital ecosystem dedicated to local entrepreneurs. Our range of solutions answers all our merchants' challenges; from reservations, through click and collect, deliveries and digital payment, to the management of their business thanks to intuitive and comprehensive financial analytics.

In SumUp POS, we are creating the world’s most complete Point of Sale, for all merchants in all businesses. We take care of the details so that merchants can focus on what they do best. We help merchants better connect to their business, to their customers and to each other.

SumUp POS offers more than a cash register, it offers an innovative ecosystem where our POS Tribe of over 400 people in Paris, Milan, Barcelona, Germany and the UK are working hard to go as far as possible and become the European leader in our market.

What you’ll do:

Build clear product KPIs and data models to help measure the effectiveness of our product strategies in achieving overall business goals
Empower our product lifecycle from ideation to launch with data-driven insights, quantitative analyses, actionable recommendations and other ad hoc support
Generate reports, dashboards, presentations etc. to nurture a data-driven community
Build and maintain a strong communication network with Product, Engineering, Data Platform & Commercial stakeholders

Previous experience:

5+ years of experience in a similar role working with Product & Engineering
Experience with Segment and Google Analytics (or similar product analytics tool)
Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests)
Experience with Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar
Great visualisation skills, ideally with Tableau
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple priorities and roadmapStrong SQL and data modelisation skills, with Dbt a big plus

Why you should join SumUp:

Have full autonomy (for real!) to propose, lead and implement changes that will up our game.
You will have the freedom to drive your career, own projects and make an impact across the company.
An amazing team and work environment that works with passion and purpose to achieve incredible results.
We get together regularly for breakfasts, team events, office parties and sports.

Additional Information 💫
Start date: as soon as possible
Full-time
Work office location(s) - Hybrid, based from Paris, Barcelona, London, Milan
Remote working: Yes - need to be based in country Location

Meet us! 💬
Recruiter Interview - 30 Minutes
VP Product Exec Interview - 45 Minutes
Analytics Lead - 45 Minutes
Test - with restitution to the product analyst pool
Bar Raiser Interview - 45 Minutes

About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating tools that help them run their businesses. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first’ attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

job description:
About the job
Company Description

¡Hola, somos Merkle! Una compañía especializada en Customer Experience Management, que forma parte del grupo global de comunicación dentsu.

Ayudamos a empresas IBEX35, grandes anunciantes y compañías Fortune 500 a desarrollar experiencias de clientes únicas y personales a través de los datos, la tecnología y la creatividad.

Poseemos capacidades únicas en Customer Experience, Data Management e Intelligence Analytics. Al tiempo que incorporamos la visión estratégica a nuestro alto grado de especialización creando una manera de trabajar única con nuestros clientes.

Con sede en Madrid, Barcelona y Gijón, la base del liderazgo de Merkle lo forman las personas. Un EQUIPO de TALENTO DIGITAL formado por profesionales con gran pasión, ilusión y potencial en su trabajo

Job Description

En MERKLE apostamos por aquellas personas a las que les gusta salir de zona de confort, que aspiran a encontrarse y superar nuevos retos y que quieren trabajar en un ambiente amigable y donde todos somos un equipo.

Buscamos personas motivadas, que se propongan retos y que se sientan cómodas trabajando en equipo y proponiendo nuevas formas de hacer las cosas. Personas que disfruten del trato con el cliente en un ambiente donde los datos nos rodean y la interpretación de los mismos es nuestro arte.

El perfil que estamos buscando tendrá como principales funciones:

Diseñar soluciones personalizadas de medición digital según requisitos del cliente.
Desarrollo de modelos estadísticos.
Validación y seguimiento de los modelos.
Elaboración de informes/dashboards de acuerdo a necesidades del cliente.
Colaborar con ingenieros de datos, desarrolladores y analistas de negocio para la puesta en producción y evolución de los modelos desarrollados.
Impartición de formaciones en remoto y presenciales.
Rigurosidad en la aplicación del método científico y la metodología de trabajo.
Formación continua en las tecnologías y disciplinas digitales de la industria.
Soporte al cliente.

Te ofrecemos un puesto de trabajo estable, de futuro, con posibilidad de promoción interna.
Trabajamos con clientes de primer nivel, empresas líderes en su sector con un alto grado de madurez digital.

Queremos que te sientas a gusto por lo que fomentamos actividades de cohesión interna para sentirnos más equipo.

Te daremos formación inicial y formación continua, aunque tu espíritu de buscar por ti mismo y tus ganas de aprender debe ser algo que marque tu desarrollo profesional con nosotros.

Fomentamos los hábitos de vida saludables y por ello tendrás seguro médico privado pagado íntegramente por la empresa.

¿Te unes al equipo? Te esperamos!!

Qualifications

Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Informática, Física, Estadística.. se valorará de forma positiva haber cursado un postgrado o master relacionado con análisis de datos o ciencia de datos.
Conocimientos avanzados en SQL, Python, R.

Seria interesante que tuvieses conocimientos acerca de los principales servicios de Google Cloud Platform, Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, BigQuery..

Lo ideal es que tengas experiencia en modelos estadísticos, así como orientación al cliente y dotes comunicativas.

El nivel de inglés para nosotros es muy importante, por lo que es importante que sea alto.

Te ofrecemos:
Contrato indefinido
Excelente ambiente de trabajo

Amplio número de días de vacaciones
Horario flexible
Horario de verano (3 meses)
Posibilidad de teletrabajar

Clases de inglés

Merkle does not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience. job description:
About the job
¡En Kimia seguimos creciendo!

Las empresas de Kimia Group somos líderes en nuestro sector, donde la ciencia y tecnología son las herramientas clave para mejorar nuestros resultados y los de nuestros clientes.

Actualmente nos encontramos buscando un Analista de Datos / Científico de Datos (Python) para nuestra empresa Erso Labs en su departamento de IT, equipo esencial para el crecimiento de las empresas del grupo. Serás el Analista de Datos / Científico de Datos de nuestro proyecto "Score".

Score es una tecnología que predice y recomienda qué componentes visuales tienen que tener imágenes, videos y textos en posts en redes sociales para tener más éxito (likes, visualizaciones, comentarios).

También detecta y recomienda qué elementos aseguran el éxito (ventas, impacto) en los assets de los anuncios online que aparecen en plataformas como Google, Facebook, Bing, etc.

Principales responsabilidades:

Análisis de datos en las plataformas de distintas redes: Google Ads, Business Manager de Facebook, TikTok Ads Manager, Twitter Ads Manager, Amazon Business, Bing, etc.
Creación y mantenimiento de pipelines de entrenamiento de modelos de machine learning de computer vision y de NLP.
Creación y mantenimiento de pipelines de entranamiento de modelos de machine learning de datos tabulares (estadísiticas) para series temporales, recomendaciones, clasificaciones y predicciones.
Creación y mantenimiento del sistema de inferencia de modelos de machine learning en los datos no estructurados (imágenes, videos y textos) extraidos de las redes sociales y de las plataformas para anunciantes más importantes.
Comunicación continua con el equipo de marketing, comprensión de los problemas de negocio y propuesta de soluciones creativas para los mismos.

REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:

Grado o Máster en una carrera de ciencias cómo matemáticas, física, ingeniería informática.
Experiencia como analista de datos / científico de datos de 3 años.
Experiencia programando con python de 3 años creando ETLs, creando informes y solucionando problemas matemáticos.
Experiencia de 2 años creando pipelines de entrenamiento, modelos de machine learning de computer vision, NLP y datos tabulares (predicción, clasificación y series temporales de datos estadísticos).
Nivel de inglés: mínimo B2.
Requerimientos Deseables:

Experiencia previa en proyectos de marketing digital en plataformas como:

Google Ads
Business Manager de Facebook
TikTok Ads Manager
Twitter Ads Manager
Amazon Business
Bing
Qué ofrecemos:

Incorporarte en una empresa referente en el mercado donde podrás seguir desarrollandote profesionalmente junto a un equipo de primer nivel.
Trabajar en una empresa joven y dinámica en la que te sentirás uno/a mas desde el primer día.
Fantástico ambiente de trabajo en el que la diversidad e inclusión es uno de nuestros pilares estratégicos.

Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año y los meses de verano.
El día de tu cumpleaños te lo damos de vacaciones.
Nuestra cultura basada en la excelencia, el aprendizaje y la responsabilidad, donde cada empleado es protagonista de su propio desarrollo.

job description:
About the job
Description

Clarity AI’s mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.
We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for an Associate - Data Research that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies’ ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies’ sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION:
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working as an Associate - Data Research you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python
Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)
Mentor and train external contractors and internal team on environmental indicators and sustainability frameworks
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed


Requirements:
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
At least a Bachelor’s degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study
2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)
Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)
Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets
Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact

*Only CVs in English will be taken into account
skills: Análisis de datos, Microsoft Excel, Capacidad de análisis, Python, Inglés, Comunicación, and SQL

job description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to know our team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It’s great if you have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

job description:
About the job
Descripción de la empresa

¡Hola, somos Merkle! Una compañía especializada en Customer Experience Management, que forma parte del grupo global de comunicación dentsu.

Ayudamos a empresas IBEX35, grandes anunciantes y compañías Fortune 500 a desarrollar experiencias de clientes únicas y personales a través de los datos, la tecnología y la creatividad.

Poseemos capacidades únicas en Customer Experience, Data Management e Intelligence Analytics. Al tiempo que incorporamos la visión estratégica a nuestro alto grado de especialización creando una manera de trabajar única con nuestros clientes.

Con sede en Madrid, Barcelona y Gijón, la base del liderazgo de Merkle lo forman las personas. Un EQUIPO de TALENTO DIGITAL formado por profesionales con gran pasión, ilusión y potencial en su trabajo

Descripción del empleo

En MERKLE apostamos por aquellas personas a las que les gusta salir de zona de confort, que aspiran a encontrarse y superar nuevos retos y que quieren trabajar en un ambiente amigable y donde todos somos un equipo.

Buscamos personas motivadas, que se propongan retos y que se sientan cómodas trabajando en equipo y proponiendo nuevas formas de hacer las cosas. Personas que disfruten del trato con el cliente en un ambiente donde los datos nos rodean y la interpretación de los mismos es nuestro arte.

El perfil que estamos buscando tendrá como principales funciones:

Diseñar soluciones personalizadas de medición digital según requisitos del cliente.
Desarrollo de modelos estadísticos.
Validación y seguimiento de los modelos.
Elaboración de informes/dashboards de acuerdo a necesidades del cliente.
Colaborar con ingenieros de datos, desarrolladores y analistas de negocio para la puesta en producción y evolución de los modelos desarrollados.
Impartición de formaciones en remoto y presenciales.
Rigurosidad en la aplicación del método científico y la metodología de trabajo.
Formación continua en las tecnologías y disciplinas digitales de la industria.
Soporte al cliente.

Te ofrecemos un puesto de trabajo estable, de futuro, con posibilidad de promoción interna.

Trabajamos con clientes de primer nivel, empresas líderes en su sector con un alto grado de madurez digital.

Queremos que te sientas a gusto por lo que fomentamos actividades de cohesión interna para sentirnos más equipo.

Te daremos formación inicial y formación continua, aunque tu espíritu de buscar por ti mismo y tus ganas de aprender debe ser algo que marque tu desarrollo profesional con nosotros.

Fomentamos los hábitos de vida saludables y por ello tendrás seguro médico privado pagado íntegramente por la empresa.

¿Te unes al equipo? Te esperamos!!

Requisitos

Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Informática, Física, Estadística.. se valorará de forma positiva haber cursado un postgrado o master relacionado con análisis de datos o ciencia de datos.

Conocimientos avanzados en SQL, Python, R.

Seria interesante que tuvieses conocimientos acerca de los principales servicios de Google Cloud Platform, Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, BigQuery..

Lo ideal es que tengas experiencia en modelos estadísticos, así como orientación al cliente y dotes comunicativas.

El nivel de inglés para nosotros es muy importante, por lo que es importante que sea alto.

Información adicional

Te ofrecemos:

Contrato indefinido
Excelente ambiente de trabajo
Seguro médico privado
Amplio número de días de vacaciones
Horario flexible
Horario de verano (3 meses)
Posibilidad de teletrabajar
Formación continua (Linkedin Learning, Merkle University, etc)
Clases de inglés

Merkle does not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience. At the point of application, the candidate must have the legal right to work in Spain as we are unable to sponsor visas at this time.

As part of our Diversity and Inclusion agenda, and as an Equal Opportunities employer, if you require reasonable adjustments during the selection process please engage directly with your Recruiter.

job description:
About the job
More digital. More human. More Minsait.
Somos una empresa líder global de tecnología y consultoría digital que conecta personas, tecnología y negocios para generar crecimiento, transformación e impacto positivo y sostenible.

Buscamos personas de Grados técnicos preferiblemente Ingenierías/Informática con ganas de trabajar en nuestra unidad de Digital Business Technologies como Consultores SAP BI, con ganas de trabajar en nuestros equipos multidisciplinares.

¿Cuál es el reto que te proponemos?

Desarrollarás en entornos SAP con tecnologías punteras como HANA, Fiori, etc.
Estarás en contacto continuo con las novedades tecnológicas, impulsando la transformación digital.
Participarás en proyectos y desarrollos que tienen una alta visibilidad y que marcan la diferencia con soluciones disruptivas y especializadas para toda la cadena de valor.


¿Qué esperamos por tu parte?

- Que poseas la titulación de Grados técnicos preferiblemente Ingenierías/Informática o similares.
- Conocimientos SAP BI
- Preferiblemente con Master SAP
- Inglés B2
- Persona con iniciativa, ganas, capacidad de análisis y trabajo en equipo.

Motivos por los que te encantará ser un #Minsaiter:

Conciliación y equilibrio: 32 días laborables de descanso, jornada intensiva en verano y teletrabajo.
Carrera profesional y formación continua adaptada a tus necesidades y motivaciones.
Contrato indefinido y retribución competitiva, seguro de vida y acceso a planes de retribución flexible.
Programa de bienestar con acceso a una red de gimnasios, servicio de telemedicina en línea gratuita y otras ventajas.

Minsait, technology for a more human future!
Nuestro compromiso es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

job description:
About the job
Job Reference ID:

230001FB

Responsibilities

Societe Generale Securities Services (SGSS) has a Commercial team in Madrid, covering Spain and Portuguese markets. The commercial team consists of a Commercial Director and two Relationship Managers.

The objective of this team is to continue developing the sales activity focus on local players and maintaining an excellent service quality for our non-resident clients. As part of our sales strategy, our goal is provide global custody, cross-border solutions and specific products to extend our services, increase our client´s data & market share, NBI and consolidate and our local presence in Spain

The VIE would have the following tasks:
Perform a detailed Product Market Analysis of the region/product
Review, analyse and document the Broker Dealer Market in the region
Review, analyse and document the Wealth Management & Alternative AM market in the region
Review, analyse and document the Insurance and Pension Fund market in the region
Review, complete and maintain the list of Tier 2 and Tier 3 Asset Management in the Region and their custody providers
Support a detailed Product Gap Analysis based in the Market insights acquired and the existing product capabilities within SGSS
For the Broker Dealer Segment and the Asset Management Segment
Support SGSS Global Sales Facilitation teams in contributing locally to transversal processes: Sales Plan, mid-year Review, Prospecting Universe definition, deals and meetings follow-up, etc.

Profile Required

PLEASE NOTE that since this program is primarily an international development program, candidates cannot apply to a VIE assignment in their own country of citizenship.

To facilitate the examination of your application by our English-speaking managers, we thank you for applying in English.

Graduate with a Master degree from Business/Engineering School or University with a specialization in Financial Markets
A previous experience in Securities servicing or business analyst in a financial environment (banking industry) could be appreciated
Analytical skills
Proficient in MS Office,
Fluent in Spanish, French and English

The VIE assignment in a nutshell

This VIE in Madrid is to begin as soon as possible but you need to plan 3 months between your application date and the beginning of your VIE assignment. It will last 12 months.

The VIE is a specific contract, under Business France’s eligibility criteria, opened to candidates under 28 and from the member states of the European Economic Space. For further information (including your financial indemnities), please see Mon VIE-VIA Business France.

We would like to draw your attention to the fact there that your VIE mission could potentially get postponed, depending on the evolution of the health crisis and subjects to the decision made by the Crisis and Support Centre of the Ministry of Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE). In addition, the selected candidate will only be paid upon confirmation from Business France and arrival in the country of assignment.

Why join us

As soon as you arrive, you will be integrated into our teams and will learn every day alongside our experts, who will support you in your tasks. Gradually, you will become more independent in your projects, making this experience a real career accelerator. You will also discover all the diversity of our businesses, in a sector that is constantly evolving and innovating.

At the end of your VIE, various opportunities could be offered to you, in France and abroad.

Business insight

At Societe Generale, we are convinced that people are drivers of change, and that the world of tomorrow will be shaped by all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.

Whether you’re joining us for a period of months, years or your entire career, together we can have a positive impact on the future. Creating, daring, innovating and taking action are part of our DNA.

If you too want to be directly involved, grow in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, you will feel right at home with us!

Still hesitating?

You should know that our employees can dedicate several days per year to solidarity actions during their working hours, including sponsoring people struggling with their orientation or professional integration, participating in the financial education of young apprentices, and sharing their skills with charities. There are many ways to get involved.

We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

job description:
About the job
¿Conoces Bravent?

¡Seguro que sí! Porque somos una de las empresas que más apuesta por las tecnologías Microsoft y porque tenemos uno de los mejores equipos que nos aporta su experiencia, creatividad y compromiso. ¡Y estamos muy orgullos@s de decirlo!
En nuestro día a día reina la innovación y, sobre todo, el buen rollo y te estamos buscando para incorporarte a nuestro equipazo como Senior Data Scientist (IA)

¿Qué vas a encontrar en Bravent?
🌻 Una compañía que apuesta por el futuro: planes de conciliación, compromiso con el medio ambiente y responsabilidad social, plan de igualdad…
📅 Jornada laboral de 36 horas (trabajamos 4 días o en jornada intensiva, ¡lo que prefieras!).
💻 Teletrabajo (pero si prefieres oficina, están a tu disposición siempre que quieras😊).
📚 Formación continua.
🏥 Seguro médico.
🕐 Horario flexible.
👩‍🏫 Clases de inglés.
🎉 Día del cumpleaños libre.
😜 ¡¡Y muchas más cosas que no te querrás perder!!

¿Por qué eres necesari@ en nuestro equipo?
Porque tienes amplios conocimientos de IA, mentalidad proactiva y te encanta pensar diferente para llegar a las mejores soluciones tecnológicas.
Porque eres versátil y te encanta enfrentarte a nuevos retos de IA que nunca habías trabajado antes.
Y porque eres comunicativo y siempre has apostado por el trabajo en equipo.
¡Y te queremos en nuestro equipo por tu pasión por las tecnologías más innovadoras!

¿Qué harás en Bravent?
Serás responsable de Inteligencia Artificial en cada proyecto del que formes parte. Para ello, tendrás todo el apoyo del equipo de IA en el que todos trabajamos conjuntamente.

Trabajarás en modalidad cross, ya que en Bravent formamos equipos multidisciplinares de diferentes áreas para ofrecer un desarrollo ideal.

Somos innovación, y por ello formarás parte de proyectos punteros, usando tecnologías de OpenAI o modelos SOTA...

Entorno tecnológico en el que trabajarás:
• Desarrollo con Python.
• Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, XGBoost…
• Cloud, principalmente en Azure.
• MLOps y su aplicación en un proyecto en producción.
• Databricks.
• Integración de modelos en las arquitecturas Data.

¿Quieres conocernos? te esperamos en:

👉 www.bravent.net
👉 peoplewithtalent@bravent.net
skills: Trabajo en equipo and Python

job description:
About the job
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Scientist into our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers’ behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions.
Turn our vast amount of data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on data exploration, modeling and analysis.
Propose, design and implement new data models (prediction, estimation, forecasting) to exploit opportunities and improve the performance of our games.
Visualize and communicate the results of your data analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Coding algorithms that can be embedded in our ongoing data processes, working closely with data engineers and scientists.
Debugging and problem-solving to ensure the quality and accuracy of your findings and metrics.
Team up with other game data scientists to lead projects on machine learning.
Requirements
2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value
A Masters degree in a quantitative field, including hard sciences (e.g Physics, Stats, Maths, Engineering) & social sciences (Economics, Psychology, Sociology…)
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for data exploratory analysis.
Creating dashboards and visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry
Curiosity about everything & ability to innovate & work independently
Nice-to-haves
Experience in a mobile B2C business .
Experience implementing data science models with Python or R .
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
Experience designing and analysing randomized experiments
A fast learner, highly meticulous , a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!
Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:
Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.
skills: Analítica de datos, Comunicación, Análisis de datos, Resolución de problemas, and Capacidad de análisis

job description:
About the job
At the SEAT:CODE we are constantly looking for talented people willing to join our projects. Our start-up environment is very open minded, we love to test and implement new ideas. If you think you are ready to enjoy your work and be part of our big family, we invite you to keep reading what we think it could be a good fit for our current needs 😊.

The Data Scientist role 🤔

Develop solutions using a range of data science techniques
Implement and understand a range of data science techniques and be able to develop models including machine learning
Collaborate with the team to develop data science solutions according to business needs
Perform analytics on data
Able to recognise and exploit business opportunities to ensure more efficient and effective performance of organisations
Develop data science solutions that are fit for purpose, resilient, scalable and future-proof, to meet user needs
Help team to achieve their goals and be aligned to business needs.
About the Team 🤗

Our technical Team loves to deliver really well-crafted solutions at decent speed. We love tech so we really give great attention to the technology (Technology as first class Citizen)
We know that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things.
We like to measure everything, so we are always improving, for that we use the best tools on the market such as Datadog.
Finally, we promote a culture of no blame, trust, and learning, and we support the mantra “if it hurts do it more often” so good CI and CD are really key for us.
What we offer 🤩

Possibility to work remotely within Spain (you can work from any city of Spain 😎)
2.000€ per year in social benefits to choose from: restaurant, kindergarten, health Insurance, private insurance, fuel, transportation, gym pass, cleaning services, WIFI, Holaluz contract, etc.
2.000€ per year in trainings
Free language courses
Daily Snacks: We try to promote healthy living habits. You will find in our canteen many nuts, fresh fruit, salads, ...
Flexible working hours: We understand the importance of work-life balance.
Short Fridays
26 days for your vacations
Best technology for your needs
Nice located offices
English as the official speaking language.

MIN REQUIREMENTS:

What we are expecting from you 🥰

At least 2 - 3 years of experience working with Python and SQL.
Passionate about big data and its potential for supporting smart decisions
Experience with AWS services like Sagemaker and S3 at least. Glue and lambda knowledge would be a plus
Knowledge on Git
Experience on working in an Agile setup
Methodical and logical approach along with creativity when approaching a problem
Knowledge on how to apply statistical methods including exploratory analysis and statistical testing to a specific data set
Be able to obtain conclusions from a data set
Able to log, analyse and manage problems to identify and implement the appropriate solution
Understanding of the organisations and the benefits of data science
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data driven insights in a clear and effective manner
Curiosity and thirst for knowledge
Advocate for feedback
Actively pursue improving skills
Collaborate with others for learning and achieving goals together
Bonus: experience in relevant vertical industries: consumer electronics, automotive, industrial, health
Fluent in English and/or Spanish.
skills: SQL, Python, Comunicación, Capacidad de análisis, and Analítica

job description:
About the job
OW a controlled 50/50 joint venture between EDP and Engie is looking for a proactive and analytical "Market Intelligence Analyst".

Are you willing to join a passionate and high performing team, in a cross-cultural, fast-paced, and strongly grOWing environment?

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

Corporate EPCI is enhancing its Market Intelligence skills, centralizing the information available in the market, and putting it at disposal of the whole company. Apart from creating, updating, and managing the databases, the team is developing in house Market Intelligence tools and providing different teams with periodic reports.

MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES

As Market Intelligence Analyst you will:
Build, update and maintain the OW Market Intelligence Database including information both from public data sources and internal knowledge.
Develop and maintain visual in-house Market Intelligence tools and dashboards to translate data contained in the OW Market Intelligence Database into executable insights.
Build and automatize the creation of regular reports and studios to periodically share with different stakeholders across the organization.

ACADEMIC BACKGROUND

University Degree Level.

LANGUAGES

OW has an international team of employees and the working language is English.

REQUIREMENTS

Advanced Excel based modelling (Visual Basics) and Power BI knowledge are essential.
Experience in creating data bases and modelling in Excel, SQL, Power BI, or more sophisticated architectures.
Experience with coding and statistical software as SQL, R or Python.

OTHER SKILLS

Competence with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Analytical and critical thinking.
High standards of organisational skills, ability to prioritise workload, able to work under pressure.
Positive & proactive attitude with self-motivated outlook.
Able to work with different teams, sometimes situated in other offices or countries.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Job location will be Madrid.

By selecting “Apply” above, you indicate:
you have read and acknowledge OW Candidates Privacy Notice: https://www.oceanwinds.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/OW_Privacy-notice-for-candidates_v3.pdf
OW is authorized to store your CV in case your job application is unsuccessful to use it in another recruitment process that may arise in the future

job description:
About the job
Project Manager / Business Analyst
Location – Madrid, Spain
Remote Working Opportunities Available.


Who are we?
Assurant, Inc. is a global leader in business services for the connected world. Our lifestyle and housing solutions help leading brands grow revenue, manage risk and provide a great experience for their customers. We support, connect and service over 300 million consumers worldwide, helping people get more value from their connected devices, vehicles and homes. Assurant is a proud member of the Fortune 500, with decades of experience in the industries we serve.


Our Values:
Common Sense, Common Decency, Uncommon Thinking and Uncommon Results guide our every action at Assurant. These values inspire our commitment to be a responsible corporate citizen.


The Opportunity:
Reporting to the Implementation Director Europe, this is an exciting opportunity to join the EU Implementation team and support Assurant Europe in driving improvement change across our business from idea stage to delivery. You will pro-actively communicate and collaborate with the primary Assurant business solutions, project and operational stakeholders to initially define and detail - supporting or leading - the production of project documentation such as Customer Journey’s, Business Process Maps, UML Sequence Diagrams, Data Flow Diagrams, and different types of Functional Requirements / Use Cases / Features; And ultimately support the Assurant business in delivering value add change across our Southern and Central Europe business units, working with all company partners and our clients to ensure outstanding service which includes supporting the Business Product Owner to achieve non-functional requirements and supporting the Agile scrum teams with implementation tasks including Business Readiness. You will manage and implement different sized programs that span over one or more lines of Business and Agile Scrum Teams. This will include following the appropriate implementation framework for building, and reporting ensuring all important partners are kept informed at an appropriate level, acting as a trusted Project Manager throughout the full project lifecycle.

This role will have a primary focus on Business Change initiatives approved by the appropriate Assurant Board, covering:
On-boarding of new clients
Performance, Process & Regulatory improvements
Improvements within current Client services
Product Development
Facilitating Continuous Improvement in the business



You Will Have:
Higher Education in Business / Economics / IT disciplines
SAFe 5.0 Scaled Agile Framework knowledge
Experience of working within projects/change on Insurance, Finance, Telecom or Supply chain delivery preferable
Good experience of delivering concurrent and often complex software-enabled projects into a pan-European landscape, working with Global Enterprise Resources to achieve success
Fluency in English and Spanish as minimum, with added language skills in Italian and / or German welcome but not essential
Strong, diverse documentation skills, ensuring all requirements captured are clear, concise and appropriate for a cross-functional Business & Technical audience (Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Visio skills highly beneficial)
Ability to communicate complex business requirements in a non-technical and simple way that encourages cross-functional advocacy both internally across the Assurant Solutions Business and externally (Clients/3rd Parties etc)
Strong Project Management skills (MS Project skills are advisable) with proven experience of working within Project/Change in Global/Regional delivery environment
Excellent presentation, communication & stakeholder management skills, including influencing & negotiation skills
Highly organized, with a flexible approach to work, ability to multi-task effectively and excellent attention to detail
Positive and pro-active mindset, with a willingness to continually stretch themselves and develop their skill set and career
Willingness to go above and beyond – and inspire their project teams to do the same – to deliver high quality, value-adding projects on time, within cost
Must thrive in an open, challenging and supportive environment with a determination to succeed
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment meeting tight deadlines while multitasking


Benefits & Training
Bonus Scheme
Private health care
Life assurance
Mobile phone & laptop
Flexible Working
Internal Wellbeing Programme
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and Development opportunities


At Assurant, diversity helps us inspire creativity in the global marketplace, and we are believers in the strategic value of inclusion and how it improves performance, creates growth opportunities, better aligns us to our clients, and enhances employee engagement.
To view a full list of the responsibilities and requirements, please visit the job description on the European Careers site.

We look forward to receiving your application!

job description:
About the job
About Arup

Arup is an independent company of engineers, architects, designers, consultants, and technical specialists offering a wide range of professional services.

It is the creative force behind some of the most important and innovative projects in today’s-built environment, both small and large in scale. With 90 offices in 35 countries, our more than 18,000 employees offer a wide range of professional services. Thus, through our work, we want to create a positive impact in our current environment.

We have been present in Spain since 1993 and we have a tea of more than 220 engineers, consultants, and qualified technical personnel. We work for clients from the public and private sectors, providing creative and sustainable solutions based on the efficient use of resources.

The role

We’re looking for an IT support analyst to be the front-door to technology services to the rest of the organisation. You will help to increase business productivity by taking a customer-focused, proactive and collaborative approach to anticipating and resolving technology issues. You will provide support and technical expertise to a range of issues relating to hardware, software, peripherals and projects.

Working under the guidance of the local service lead, you will be part of a larger team that provides customer-focused digital services to Arup globally. This is a full time, level 2 support role in a typical IT support infrastructure, with a business-focused mindset.

We provide opportunities for all our people to develop their skills, along with challenging and innovative work in an environment that allows individuals to flourish. We believe in continuous learning; providing a culture that is naturally curious and always stimulating. One that promotes self-discovery and allows people time to be creative.

“ I enjoy the variety of my role - no two days are the same. One day I might be reassuring a nervous presenter minutes before they present to hundreds of colleagues via a live stream. The next day I might be trying to fix a laptop remotely with a colleague who has a looming deadline or showing them how to get the most out of the latest digital tools .” Caitlin, Brisbane.

Responsibilities Of The Role Include

Acting as client liaison for all Digital Technology-related requests from staff, being first line of engagement to understand and address issues and needs around desktop (Windows, O365 etc.) and infrastructure (compute, storage, network, cloud services, enterprise systems, cybersecurity, etc.), engaging and escalating to other Digital Technology teams as needed
Providing value added services to the business, working together with the leadership team to drive technology and help transform business activities
Configuring, deploying, maintaining, troubleshooting and supporting workstations, laptops, printers, mobile devices, phones and other computer and telecoms equipment
Solving problems associated with hardware (PCs, Macs, mobile, etc.), software, and services (video conferencing, remote access, etc.) determining the source of problems and classifying their level, priority and nature. When appropriate, escalating or routing them to the appropriate team
Helping with a range of office-based technology needs – installations, moves, changes, etc. that involve staff requirements and infrastructure needs, working collaboratively with other DT service teams
Responding to, documenting and resolving service tickets in a timely manner according to an agreed service level
Documenting procedures, standards, best practices configurations, settings, installation sequences and back-out instructions
Following ITIL/Service Management policies and procedures
Helping the software asset management team to maintain applications (license management and version control)
Helping with communications and training around technical change
Playing an active part in our team: helping to build an inclusive environment, sharing your knowledge and promoting best technology practices with colleagues

Some of the technology you could expect to support includes:

Personal computing (HP, Mac, etc.)
Mobile computing (iPhone, iPad, Samsung etc. depending on office or regional policy)
Microsoft Windows Operating System, Mac OSx (limited)
Microsoft 365 and associated services (i.e. OneDrive for Business, MS Teams, etc.)
Cloud based solutions (Azure, AWS, etc.)
Video conferencing hardware/software based on global standards
Office printers and copiers (these vary depending on office or regional policy)

Please don’t be discouraged if you don’t meet every point below – if you meet most, and are strongly motivated by the role, and willing to learn, we are still interested in hearing from you.

Minimum Requirements

Some (1 to 2 years’) experience working in a regional or global organisation providing desktop support services in a Microsoft environment
A desire to learn, you should have a track record of developing your technical knowledge and applying new skills in a high paced environment
Good analytical skills, with ability to solve problems and openness in sharing your knowledge and thinking with others
Experience of ServiceNow or similar IT Service Management systems
Some experience working in a professional services organisation

Assessable Requirements

Familiarity with MS Teams and O365
Familiarity with technical software solutions from Autodesk, Bentley, Trimble, etc
Familiarity with software solutions from Adobe, Bluebeam, Cisco, Symantec, etc

Conditions

Immediate incorporation

How to apply for this vacancy?

To apply for this vacancy, register your updated CV and a cover letter in English.

Why work at Arup?

We work on innovative and international projects collaborating with different disciplines and offices around the world
We offer flexible check-in and check-out hours and a hybrid work model
You will have the possibility of living a professional experience abroad, through our international assignments
We have continuous training through our Arup University platform, LinkedIn Learning licenses and access to virtual English/Spanish classes
We are committed to equal opportunities through the objectives established in our equality plan
You can participate in groups such as EDI (equality, diversity and inclusion), Community Engagement (commitment to different communities) and Ovagreen (commitment to the environment)
We promote a healthy life among our employees through subsidies with different sports centers, inter-company leagues, tournaments, free daily coffee, tea, local fruit...
We allocate several of our profits to knowledge at work, with the possibility of financing research through the Invest in Arup program
We are committed to a young and dynamic work environment, in which juniors and seniors share values and learn from each other through internal activities
We contribute part of our annual benefits to solidarity projects, such as the design and construction of various buildings and infrastructures in developing countries
The independence of Arup as a company allows us to share with all Arupians a part of the profits obtained globally twice a year
Arup is, according to the ranking of Actualidad Económica, El Mundo, one of the best companies to work for in Spain in 2022

What are we searching for?

At Arup we place sustainability at the heart of our projects and invest in research and development to address issues such as climate change and poverty. We have committed to achieving the goal of net zero emissions by 2030 and making a significant contribution to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.

Therefore, we look for people who share these concerns and interests, creating shared value for our customers and our communities while safeguarding our planet. Arup commits to net zero across global operations by 2030 - Arup

job description:
About the job
Grupo Construcía es el primer ecosistema de empresas de servicios de circularidad en Europa para el sector inmobiliario. Nuestra actividad abarca desde la consultoría estratégica hasta la construcción, rehabilitación y gestión de activos circulares.

Somos la suma de 5 compañías:
- Construcía: pioneros en construcción circular.
- Construcía Instalaciones: instalaciones circulares, resilientes y saludables.
- Eco Intelligent Growth: consultora en economía circular e innovación, basada en los principios Cradle to Cradle®.
- Circular Capital: sociedad de gestión de inversiones inmobiliarias de impacto positivo.
- Dear Planet: nace para conceptualizar, diseñar, construir, gestionar y deconstruir espacios efímeros aplicando criterios de circularidad.

Como primer ecosistema empresarial de servicios de circularidad, tenemos el propósito de generar impacto positivo transformando el mundo a través del sector de la construcción y llevarlo al resto de los sectores relacionados.

Contamos con una consolidada trayectoria de 20 años de actividad. Hemos implantado con éxito la economía circular en el complejo sector de la construcción con proyectos emblemáticos, gracias a nuestra propia metodología LEAN2CRADLE® Construcía, basada en los principios de la economía circular y el LEAN Construction. Y estamos trasladando estos principios de actuación al resto de los sectores económicos, para impulsar la economía circular.

En Grupo Construcía trabajamos por un mundo en el que los negocios regeneren los ecosistemas y la sociedad, colaborando con empresas y organizaciones en la transición hacia modelos de negocio y diseños de productos innovadores, seguros y circulares.

Transformamos los modelos productivos hacia la economía circular, como demanda la sociedad, y contribuimos a los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible, la Agenda 2030 y los retos de 2050.

Contamos con más de 300 profesionales que desarrollan su actividad en las sedes en Madrid, Barcelona y Lisboa, con el firme compromiso de contribuir a un crecimiento económico rentable y respetuoso con la salud de las personas y el medio ambiente.

Desde Grupo Construcía nos encontramos en búsqueda de perfiles de Area Manager Data & Analytics, siendo responsable IT de proyectos, desarrollos y mantenimiento correctivo evolutivo de sistemas asociados a la gestión de datos informacionales de la compañía, así como el soporte al uso de tecnologías exhaustivas en dato del resto de áreas cuyas funciones principales son:

Las funciones principales serán:
Liderar área IT que se encarga de los sistemas informacionales de la compañía.
Armar y gestionar ejecución proyectos de transformación/implantación del área.
Ser referencia de la tecnología de gestión de datos en el grupo.
Gestión de la demanda, gestión de servicio.
Mantenimiento y resolución de incidencias software del área.
Gestión de equipo y recursos del área.

Requisitos deseables:
Experiencia (5+ años) como responsable de equipos de IT a nivel de departamento/área o similar en el área de gestión del dato
Background tecnológico importante en ingeniería de datos, business intelligence (BI), analítica de datos, capaz de diseñar soluciones de datos a partir de los requisitos y de establecer la arquitectura informacional de la compañía a alto nivel.
Experiencia previa lanzando proyectos de transformación de Data a partir de Iniciativas de negocio, en un modelo colaborativo y activando los recursos necesarios dentro de la organización (todos, no solo los tecnológicos).
Experiencia gestionando proveedores de servicios y partners tecnológicos. Habilidad para lanzar procesos de RFP/RFI y nuevas iniciativas.
Experiencia utilizando modelos de gestión de la demanda para áreas usuarias. Experiencia en la gestión de proyectos (varios a la vez) y en la gestión de equipos multidisciplinares.
Experiencia en gestión presupuestaria de proyectos y departamentos.
Experiencia de implantación de soluciones tecnológicas de datos (gobierno del dato, reporting, big data, herramientas BI, visualización y consumo de la información). Deseable conocimiento en la aplicación de modelos de analítica avanza, AI/ML y la gestión de disponibilidad desde el punto de vista de usuario (data scientist) de esos entornos.
Experiencia en aplicación de metodologías Agiles, adaptación de modelos de integración continua en data y calidad.
Nivel de Inglés alto.

¿Qué ofrecemos?
- Contrato indefinido desde el primer momento.
- Porcentaje sobre objetivos.
- Flexibilidad horaria.
- Modelo híbrido de trabajo (presencial / remoto).
- Buen ambiente de trabajo.
- Vacaciones el día de tu cumpleaños (Bday).
- Plan de Retribución Flexible.

Hay un lugar para ti, seas quien seas. Promovemos una cultura de Diversidad e inclusión. Grupo Construcía está comprometido con el principio de igualdad de oportunidades para todas las personas que quieran participar de nuestro propósito. Promovemos un entorno de trabajo inclusivo basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad va más allá donde nuestro propósito y nuestros valores están presentes en cualquier ámbito de actuación.

job description:
About the job
There will never be a typical day at Accenture Digital, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference while working on exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing space. job description:
About the job
As a part of VIE program we are looking for a highly motivated Graduate with first professional experience to join our Finance Team in Universal Enclosures Business of Schneider Electric.

As a Junior Financial Controller, you will have a chance to improve your financial, analytical and technical skills while working for a Leader and Game Changer in Energetic Industry. You will be responsible for run and improvement of the Global Financial Reporting within the UE Organization. You will prepare Country and Customer profitability analysis, supporting improvement of the Financial Performance. You will also support commercial and marketing teams on ad hoc analysis if needed.

What will you do?

Construct monthly sales performance reports for sales force and operational teams
Analyze country P&L and develop commercial performance measurement for different offers
Automate and improve existing reporting layer
Develop customer profitability analysis with international commercial teams to implement actions and improve KPIs
Understand pricing trends and develop analysis to make pricing recommendations
Work in matrix organization

What qualifications will make you successful?

MS degree in Finance, Economics or related field
Strong analytical skills, attention to details
Strong technical skills: Advanced Excel command is essential (Database and VBA is a plus)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively with international teams. Good presentation skills.
Fluent in English, Spanish and French is a plus

Personal Qualities :

Enthusiastic person with a positive attitude
Willingness to work in a multicultural team
Comfortable with online teamwork
Helpful and supportive towards team members
Resilient and able to adapt to change

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Pourquoi nous?

Schneider Electric est la référence en matière de transformation numérique de la gestion de l'énergie et de l'automatisation. Nos technologies permettent au monde d'utiliser l'énergie de manière sûre, efficace et durable. Nous nous efforçons de promouvoir une économie mondiale à la fois viable sur le plan écologique et hautement productive.

25,7 milliards d'euros de chiffre d'affaires global

137 000+ employés dans plus de 100 pays

45 % du chiffre d'affaires de l'IdO

5 % du chiffre d'affaires consacré à la R&D

Vous devez soumettre une demande en ligne pour que votre profil soit pris en considération pour un poste chez nous. Ce poste sera visible juqu'à ce qu'il soit pourvu.
