job description:
About the job
HCLTech is an Indian-born global technology company helping companies reinvent their businesses for the digital age. HCL provides end-to-end services across industry verticals to leading companies, including 250 of the Fortune 500 and 650 of the Global 2000.

Our goal is to strengthen the brand in Spain. We are looking for an expert to work as Business Analyst!

Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled business analyst with a strong background in the finance sector, IT, Agile methodology and experience in robotic process automation (RPA) and business process management (BPM). The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving process improvements, implementing innovative solutions, and providing critical insights to support our strategic initiatives.

What you'll do:

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, gather requirements, and develop operational solutions to address complex financial and IT challenges.
• Analyse and optimize business processes through the application of RPA, BPM and any other IT solution ensuring efficiency, compliance and scalability.
• Leverage Agile methodology to manage projects, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions that align with business objectives.
• Develop and maintain documentation, including process maps, user stories and functional specifications to ensure a clear understanding of requirements and solutions. Evaluate the success of implemented solutions, identifying areas for ongoing improvement and iteration.

Education level:

•University BSc. degree in finance, computer science, information systems or a related field

What do you need to know?

• 3+ years of experience as a business analyst in the finance sector, with a focus on IT and process improvement.
• Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and project management best practices.
• Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.

What do we value?

Intermediate English language level (B1)
Proven experience with RPA and BPM tools such as UiPath, Appian, Blue Prism, Pega or similar.

Important to note:

- If you have a valid disability certificate, Certificate of Disability in Force, please contact us.

Among HCL's principles we would like to highlight diversity and inclusion as a strength in our values and practices. To achieve all our objectives, it intends to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as a key factor and differentiator of fundamental innovation in our organization. job description:
About the job
Our Opportunity

The Group Information Governance (GIG), Data Loss Prevention Operations (DLPaaS) Team is responsible for initial analysis, monitoring and escalation of data loss events (event handling) detected from cloud, endpoint, and email data protection controls. Our role is to protect the Zurich’s intellectual property from leaving the company.

You will be exposed to various forms of alerts that may include security breaches, intellectual property theft, insider trading, fraud and avoidance of security controls. You will also see personal information as well as confidential and highly confidential company information.

The DLP Analyst will be primarily responsible for the maintenance and daily monitoring of the enterprise DLP solutions. The main duties of the person in this role will include the monitoring and responding to the alerts that generate from the tool. This person will interface closely with other GIG Information Protection Analysts, members of the Incident Management Team from the Business Unit.

Opportunity to work for the Group Information Governance/Group Information Security team with leading edge technologies and processes and subject matter expertise.

Your role

As a Data Loss Prevention Analyst your main responsibilities will be:

Monitoring alerts generated from the DLP systems and other technologies
Understanding and following the incident management process and engaging with end users in alignment with local requirements
Responding to escalations by the Incident Management Team
Supporting to DLP rule implementation, monitoring the rules functionality, reporting gaps and issues
Supporting to make a continuous improvement for DLP policies and rules conditions
Providing constant feedback

Your Skills And Experience

As a Data Loss Prevention Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:

Demonstrated integrity in a professional environment
Confident with speaking to people at all levels
Excellent administration skills, analytic and attention to detail, with some working knowledge of Zurich (or other financial institution) and its business and practices
Teamwork mindset to work within diverse, global, virtual team
Able to prioritize, organize and manage time efficiently
Fluent in English, written and verbal communication, other language is a plus (German, Spanish, Portuguese, Japanese etc.,)
Knowledge or experience with any of these tools: Microsoft Purview, Defender, Power App, Power BI, Power Automate, Proofpoint, Symantec Endpoint, Palo Alto Prisma SaaS is a plus
Knowledge or experience in DLP, Data Protection, Information Security, Data analysis, Compliance, Insurance is a plus

Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:

Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts

Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button “Apply online”.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer.  We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

You are the heart & soul of Zurich!

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.

Let’s continue to grow together!

Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: Yes
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Alvaro Gallego Zazo

About the job
In HAYS we are collaborating with a consulting boutique focused on the Financial Services of European Market with a Specialised and Targeted Approach. Work experience and external project experience.

Advanced English.

What we offer?
Hybrid Mode, (Madrid).

job description:
About the job
Role

Our EMEA Data Team is looking for an Associate Data Research Analyst to process our data across global markets. We are a team of data analysts who have effective relationships with other teams and are committed to deliver best quality data. As a Data Research Analyst in the Data Division, you will work closely with the Global Data Team and Local Business Representatives, taking responsibility for data coverage, quality, and timeliness to the highest standards. The Operation Data Analyst will form closer links with providers related to data acquisition processes and gain knowledge of our database. The position will be based in our Data and Development Center EMEA in Madrid.

Responsibilities
Collaborate closely with the global data teams
Data expert on investment data points, processes, methodologies, calculations & different fund structures
Manage business relationships with fund companies. Connecting with providers & setting up acquisition channels as well as acting as a point of escalation
Meet the predetermined production deadlines for internal and external clients
Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects.
Utilize project management methodologies such as LEAN Six Sigma to track, evaluate and determine resolution approach for complex data issues.
Collect and maintain Morningstar data, ensuring high levels of data accuracy, completeness and coverage.
Demonstrate a high sense of ownership of the issues in the data ticket queue to be responsive and provide timely updates, follow-up, expedition, and resolution.
Understand roles, responsibilities, and expertise of internal partners to expedite issue resolution.
Translate requests from internal clients into detailed written specifications and user stories.
Improve and document client use cases to ensure any new functionality meets and exceeds client expectations

Requirements
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required
Proficient oral and written communication skills. Fluent in English and 2 other European languages (German, French, Dutch, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese)
Collaborates well in a team environment, have the ability to communicate and work with team members from diverse backgrounds, in a conscientious and inclusive way.
Sensitive to clients’ needs
Solid understanding of the financial industry and passionate about investment data.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills, capable of handling high volumes of data and meeting strict deadlines
You will be collaborating with cross functional teams and leading from the front when it comes to Operational data, Performance data, etc, so experience within data methodology/quality and processes is a big bonus.
Previous experience in project management is preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

job description:
About the job
Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.
Digital Analyst eCommerce
The following position is open in Madrid, Spain.

What makes this a great opportunity?

Beam Suntory recently entered an amazing race, sailing bravely through the exciting waves of the digital ocean. In typical Beam Suntory fashion, we just "go for it", Yatte Minahare! We're entrepreneurial, agile, dynamic and friendly, and love having fun on and off the job! The role is a fantastic opportunity to have a tangible impact, building the digital analytics capability within the regional eCommerce and Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) business unit (eMU). As well as gain experience in the exciting spirits industry and fast-paced Digital Commerce channel. All in all, a fantastic "learn, apply and deliver" opportunity for any ambitious self-starter.
Role Responsibilities

Develop the digital analytics capability within the eCommerce and D2C business unit (eMU), to support the delivery of 2023 targets and enable Beam Suntory’s growth ambition
Work closely with the D2C team to build full-funnel analytics capabilities. Set the benchmark for 360 digital analyses on marketing activations (owned, earned and paid channels), and identify new opportunities for growth through CLV and CAC optimization
Collaborate with core eMU functions, and Local Marketing, Media and Commercial teams to enable and optimize our funnels, programs, marketing channels, and campaigns through marketing analytics-informed insights
Be the ambassador of Growth Marketing within the organization, driving internal education, establishing the mindset (data and experimentation), and embedding the corresponding frameworks (process and funnel wise)
Lead Success & Knowledge sharing (learning platform), standardizing frameworks for measurement, best practices and how-to-guides across eSearch, eContent and eShopper, ensuring learnings are translated into relevant business recommendations
Support Annual Planning (1y) and Growth Planning (3y) process, regarding marketing spend and contribution based on analytics of prior performance
Own roadmap of pilots and new tools to test (learning platform) across the eMU marketing team
Collaborate and feedback eData and Global reports to help improve performance measurement and preserve data quality. Proactively input processes that can be improved with better analytics using existing data
Champion performance enhancement projects, such as brand investment (BI) effectiveness and attribution modelling
Guide IT team on systems/tools/martech needed to optimize marketing performance, track customer behavior, or enhance customer experience
Liaise with Global IT, Global Insights, Global Digital Commerce, Global Brand House Digital teams, and Local Markets to ensure the successful development and integration of the digital analytics capability in the organization
Qualifications & Experience
Qualifications and experience:

5+ years proven experience in similar role (digital analytics or growth marketing work)
Knowledge of digital marketing (and its metrics) across website and owned media as well as search (organic and paid), social, display, and programmatic platforms
Knowledge of web analytics (social and search, paid and organic), CRO, experiment design and full funnel marketing
Superior Analytical skills, data-driven mindset, and process oriented
Ability to structure business problems into data analytics plans, and analytics output into actionable insight and business strategies
Test & learn experience, piloting projects and sharing best practices
Think big and have a growth mindset and love to turn data into insight
Learning agility, curiosity and always up to date (trends, tools, techniques, etc)
Ability to operate simultaneously and effectively in both tactical and strategic modes
Professional proficiency in English
Capable of building effective and collaborative work relationships
Excellent communicator, can explain complex problems simply
Able to manage multiple projects, highly organized and detail-oriented
Willingness to lead, own and roll up sleeves to get things done
Self-starter with an ability to deal with ambiguity in a new role
Software requirements:
Google Analytics certification (GA4 preferred)
Knowledge Semrush, Similar Web, and Supermetrics
Data visualization/reporting tools such as PowerBi, Google Data Studio
Experience working with a CDP and email marketing tool (SFMC)
Preferred Qualifications:

(Traditional) Marketing background would be an asset
P&L understanding and (traditional) business KPIs (market share)
Experience working in a start-up where you had to define best practices
Experience in marketing research and statistical analysis
Experience in the alcoholic beverages industry a plus
Software engineering, automation, machine learning knowledge valuable

At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. Beam Suntory is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, military veteran status and all other characteristics, attributes or choices protected by law. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant’s skills and experience.

job description:
About the job
AIR LIQUIDE HEALTHCARE INTERNATIONAL SERVICES & TECHNOLOGY SPAIN (ALHIST SPAIN) es una empresa dentro del Grupo AIR LIQUIDE, líder mundial en gases medicinales, cuidado de la salud en el hogar, higiene e ingredientes galénicos, con más de 66.000 empleados repartidos en diferentes sectores.

Como parte de la organización Air Liquide Healthcare Digital & IT, ALHIST SPAIN, tiene como misión proporcionar a Air Liquide herramientas y soluciones innovadoras, enfocadas a pacientes y profesionales sanitarios que faciliten la gestión integral de la enfermedad, contribuyendo con todos nuestro conocimiento en el sector sanitario y en el desarrollo de dispositivos médicos. Adicionalmente, ALHIST Spain se encarga del desarrollo de herramientas para realizar analítica avanzada de datos, inteligencia de negocio e inteligencia artificial.

Nuestra visión es, junto con las operaciones de Air Liquide Home Healthcare, y a través de las soluciones que desarrollamos, lograr la transformación del modelo de provisión de atención médica en todo el mundo y junto a ello:

* Preservar la calidad de vida de los pacientes en el hogar.
* Mejorar la atención y comprensión de la enfermedad gracias a la eSalud
* Anticiparse a las necesidades de los pacientes y de los profesionales sanitarios.
* Y construir un sistema de salud que sea eficiente y virtuoso para todos.

En ALHIST SPAIN buscamos un Business Analyst de Software para unirse a nuestra empresa y trabajar junto con el Service Delivery Manager en los procesos y la gestión de las incidencias. El candidato trabajará junto con un equipo de soporte cuyo objetivo es cumplir con los SLA pactados y mantener la satisfacción con los productos desplegados en Producción.

Sus funciones principales son:

Analizar y clasificar las incidencias.

Gestionar incidencias de los productos comercializados.

Cribar y detectar Incidencias susceptibles de ser notificables a las autoridades competentes y comunicarlo al Responsable de Vigilancia.

Definición de soluciones técnicas para las incidencias de los productos comercializados.



Requisitos mínimos

Nociones de Python, Mongo DB y AWS.

Conocimientos de ITIL.

Habilidades para la obtención y análisis de información.

Mentalidad centrada en el cliente.

Flexibilidad mental de criterios.

Capacidad analítica muy alta.

Trabajo en equipo.

La experiencia en el campo del software médico también se recibiría positivamente.

Experiencia previa como desarrollador.



Estudios mínimos y experiencia

Técnico universitario cualificado y/o con experiencia mínima de 2 años como desarrollador, analista o QA.



Idiomas

Air Liquide es una empresa francesa, nuestro idioma común es el inglés, por lo que estamos buscando un candidato con comunicación alta.

job description:
About the job
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!

Job Description

Offering intelligent and proactive individuals their first step in the gaming industry, the Market Intelligence team is key department in our studio. Your primary tasks will be centred around market research. In addition, you will spend up to a year working across different areas including Product, Marketing and Data. Following a successful year, we will work with you to find your perfect role in Socialpoint (or you can stay in MI).

Role Responsibilities
Identity, collect & analyze competitors to uncover market opportunities & address business needs.
Identify market trends and patterns and share findings with different stakeholders.
Translate data into executable and effective market & intelligence reports.
Analyse performance of Socialpoint games against close competitors.
Act as an Internal analyst for different studios within the company.
Desired Experience & Qualifications
High level of English, both written and spoken (English is our official language!)
1-3 years of experience, preferably in a top consulting firm, Investment Banking company or tech company.
High level of Excel & PowerPoint.
Strong presentation skills.
Excellent cross-group & team-work collaboration.
Analytical & creative skills in developing hypothesis.
Energetic & strong business acumen.
Good organization & detail oriented skills with excellent follow-up capabilities.
Ability to work under pressure & handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Positive & proactive attitude, with a flexible & self-motivated outlook.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English & Spanish & Catalan ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!
Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:
Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

job description:
About the job
¡Hola! 👋

Sabemos que 𝐛𝐮𝐬𝐜𝐚𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐜𝐚𝐦𝐛𝐢𝐨, sí, no lo niegues, estás explorando nuevos proyectos ofertas y empresas, algo te gustaría cambiar. Nos gustaría que, en esta oferta de empleo pares, 𝐧𝐨 𝐡𝐚𝐠𝐚𝐬 𝐬𝐜𝐫𝐨𝐥𝐥 directamente a las responsabilidades, conocimientos, y todas esas cosas que buscamos de ti.

Porque primero queremos presentarnos…
Lo primero de todo 𝐬𝐨𝐦𝐨𝐬 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐬, lo segundo que 𝐬𝐨𝐦𝐨𝐬 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐬 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐚𝐦𝐚𝐧 𝐥𝐚 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠í𝐚 💙🦾. Pertenecemos a la #Familiaat de atSistemas, consultora líder en el sector de tecnología con clientes a nivel internacional. 2023 está siendo nuestro 29º año de existencia, con un crecimiento del 30% en nuestra cifra de negocio y más de 2.400 personas en nuestro equipo. Todo ello, sin dejar de ser una compañía diferente, una compañía donde las personas son de verdad lo primero y donde la meritocracia se impone.

job description:
About the job
We are looking for an IT Business Analyst to be part of our Digital Manufacturing Team.

Position Snapshot
Location: Nestlé Global Hub in Barcelona, Spain
Stream: IT, Technical and Production
Permanent Contract
Type of work: Hybrid/Remote
Work Language: Fluent Business English

The role

Manufacturing Execution System, Business Analyst .

What You’ll Do
Works with the Digital Manufacturing team collaboratively
Writes and maintains test scripts
Performs testing
Configuration of digital manufacturing applications
Documentation of best practices
Subject matter expert for digital manufacturing applications
Support of applications within the digital manufacturing area: such as DMO, Poka, Connect, etc.
Troubleshooting and analysis
Validates development provided by vendors(Agile Methodology)
Provides appropriate training to the Regions and System Integrators

We offer you

We offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.
Great benefits including competitive salary and a comprehensive social benefits package. We have one of the most competitive pension plans on the market, as well as flexible remuneration with tax advantages: health insurance, restaurant card, mobility plan, etc.
Personal and professional growth through ongoing training and constant career opportunities reflecting our conviction that people are our most important asset.
Hybrid working environment with flexible working scheme. Our state-of-the-art campus is dog friendly and equipped with a medical center, canteen and areas to co-create network and chill!
Recreation activities such as yoga, Zumba, etc. and a wide range of volunteering activities.

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's or master's degree in information systems, computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent work experience
5+ years of experience in a combination of Manufacturing IT, Engineering, and/or Automation.
Experience with PowerBI and reporting
Experience having worked in a global environment and with virtual teams
Excellent English communication skills applied with different stakeholders, nationalities, and mediums (face-to-face and remote)
Proven ability to work in Agile project teams

About The IT Hub

We are a team of IT professionals from many countries and diverse backgrounds, each with unique missions and challenges in the biggest health, nutrition and wellness company of the world. We innovate every day through forward-looking technologies to create opportunities for Nestlé’s digital challenges with our consumers, customers and at the workplace. We collaborate with our business partners around the world to deliver standardized, integrated technology products and services to create tangible business value.

About Nestlé

The Nestlé Group is the world’s largest food and beverage company with 87 billion Swiss Francs in sales in 2021. It is present in 189 countries around the world, has 413 factories and its 323,000 employees are committed to Nestlé’s purpose of enhancing quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Nestlé offers a wide portfolio of products and services for people and their pets throughout their lives. Its more than 2000 brands range from global icons like Nescafé or Nespresso to local favourites. Company performance is driven by its Nutrition, Health and Wellness strategy. Nestlé is based in the Swiss town of Vevey where it was founded more than 150 years ago. Learn more about our Group and reasons to join us on www.nestle.com.

We are Nestlé, the largest food and beverage company. We are 308,000 employees strong driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Our values are rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for our future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic inclusive international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions and geographies, working with diverse teams and cultures. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com.

job description:
About the job
The new position will perform the role of business analyst for several business applications being deployed in Europe. He/she will lead the implementation of small to medium IT projects and will contribute to the continuous evolution of business applications in close alignment with business key users and other IT operating units. The position will be based on Madrid.
We are looking for a curious and proactive person willing to understand business processes and contribute to the adoption of IT solutions, primarily within Logistics and Operations areas but interacting with other business departments as well. Project management experience running small/medium projects would help the candidate to succeed in that role.
Specifically, the company is onboarded in a digital a transformation journey which implies the replacement of legacy applications and the implementation of a wide range of modern IT solutions, so he/she will be participating in some projects aligned with this strategy.
He/she will be part of the IT Logistics & Operations operating Unit in Europe reporting to the IT Logistics & Operations Applications manager Europe.

Responsibilities:
Interaction with business stakeholders, identifying explicit and implicit needs and collecting requirements.
Understand technical options, limitations, costs and risks in order to communicate trade-offs to business partners.
Functional design of processes as a base for the development of new functionalities.
Responds to user requests, applications incidents and problems on a timely manner.
Contribution to the resolution of issues and implementation of enhancements with the support of other members of the team and IT service providers.
Leadership of small/medium projects taking responsibilities in their initiation, planning and execution. Controlling scope, timeline, budget, team and risks for each project.
Education:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, other related field.
Project Management certification (PMP, Scrum, other) will be appreciated.

Experience:
Typically has 5 of more years of IT and work experience:
Business analyst experience ideally in at least one of the following areas (Content Management, H&S, Field Services and/or Logistic Optimization applications)
Liaising between IT department and Business.
ProJect management
Familiar with standard ERP data models and data integration patterns
Languages:
· Fluent written and spoken Spanish.
· Fluent written and spoken English.
Competencies:
Ability to quickly learn the objectives, structures, operations and policies of new business areas.
Strong problem resolution, negotiation and influencing skills.
Demonstrated ability to engage both IT stuff and business partners to achieve target outcomes.
Proven interpersonal skills and an ability to influence senior leaders and peers.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to explain technical information in a condensed manner to various stakeholders.
Experience creating documentation such as business cases or business requirements summaries.
Proactive, adaptable and willing to learn new skills and to be onboarded in new IT solutions.
Availability to travel in Europe (around 10%-15% of the time).

job description:
About the job
Company Description

More than 20 years ago, zooplus was one of the first to bring the pet category into the world of eCommerce. Today, we stand strong as Europe’s leading online pet platform, delivering moments of happiness to more than 9 million pet parents each year.

Job Description

We are looking for a CRM Data Specialist to join our zooplus team in Madrid. You will join the Central Direct Marketing Team consisting of 6 people and will be responsible for the Europe-wide Direct Marketing analysis activities (email marketing, print campaigns, push notification campaigns).

In this role, you will support the team and the local managers on data aggregation, data analysis, visualization and customer targeting. To be successful in this role, you should have solid experience with Analytical Systems.

Your Responsibilities

Work closely with all CRM/Direct Marketing, IT, Data Science, and BI teams to structure and analyze CRM data, identify high value actions or customer pain points, and translate findings into actionable insights for business teams
Develop data visualizations, dashboards, reports, and ad-hoc analysis to provide recommendations to Senior Management, CRM/Direct Marketing, and other business teams on the development of the key metrics that drive Customer Lifetime Value.
Provide complex customer selections as campaign-support for the CRM/Direct Marketing team to enable targeted customer communication across all channels (e-mail, print, mobile push notifications, and more).
Support the ongoing development of the Data Access Layer (DAL) and onboarding of relevant data sets for Distribution; transform, validate, and model data with the purpose of understanding and drawing conclusions
Drive various analytical projects in close collaboration with your stakeholders. Continuously explore opportunities to improve the CRM system and enhance the end-user experience; proactively gather user feedback and requirements.

Your Perspectives

Make an impact. You will be empowered by a dedicated development team of CRM veterans, working alongside experienced Data Science and BI colleagues using a state-of-the-art toolset.
Push boundaries. We are one team. Everyone is equally important and works together on uncharted challenges alongside inspiring colleagues from all around the world.
Grow with us. We challenge you and encourage your personal development with individual external and internal training, conference visits, and regular appraisals.
Feel home. We provide you with a mobile phone, a comfortable working space, generous remote working options, fresh fruit and free beverages, casual dress code, various employee discounts (e.g. for a gym membership or corporate benefits), and more.
Trust-based working. We don't punch the clock – organize your own schedule. We trust in what you do!

Qualifications

University degree in a relevant technical or analytical field, minimum 2 years of relevant work experience
Strong SQL knowledge (ideally ANSI SQL and/or experience with Oracle and Presto specific syntax) and good knowledge of statistical methods
Experience with data-lakes and managing structured/unstructured datasets, ideally in Athena/Presto/Oracle. Knowledge of lean ETL processes to eject data from data marts and load it into external systems on a scheduled basis.
Strong interest and good understanding of eCommerce data and CRM/Customer data for Direct Marketing execution, ideally with experience in the retail industry.
Experience with creating visualizations and reports in Tableau or similar data-visualization tools
Analytical mindset and enthusiasm for understanding our customers, coupled with a passion for numbers and large amounts of data to help implement strategic actions to optimize the Customer Experience and increase Customer Lifetime Value
High attention to detail, independent working style, and very good English communication skills.

Additional Information

With more than 1,000 passionate professionals located across 10 European offices, we believe our success comes from working together and leveraging our international strengths. Expect to work in a hybrid environment, collaborating with colleagues in different locations remotely or face-to-face at the office.

Our benefits:

🐾 20% discount in our zooplus shop

📖 Internal and external training

🎈 Team events

✈️ 28 Annual Vacation Days

🩺 Private Medical Health Insurance

⏰ Hybrid working model (up to 60% remote)

Want to know more? Learn more about who we are and what we do and visit our LinkedIn company profile.

zooplus is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.

job description:
About the job
Who we are

In the past, to be a successful restaurateur, you simply had to have a passion for food and a passion for people - but to succeed as a digital restaurateur you also need to have a passion for technology. We believe in the joy of serving others, and that's why we created Otter – to help restaurateurs succeed in online food delivery. Restaurants around the world, both large and small, including Chick-fil-A, Ben & Jerry’s, KFC, and Eataly trust our software to power their delivery business. We increase sales, reduce order issues, and decrease delivery headaches. Here is a peek into how it works.

What you’ll do

As a Migrations Operations Data Analyst you will be responsible for planning and executing large-scale migrations of Otter Customers (Merchants) from legacy to 2.0 systems.

Scheduling: Roadmap intelligent migration waves. Provide continual forecasting and status updates.
Stakeholder Management: World class communications within the company and Partner-facing.
Data-savvy Ops: Identifying and catering to Customer cohort criteria.
Problem Solving / Quality Control: Identify past failures and future hurdles. Provide solutions.
Work closely with a Data Analytics teammate to execute migrations.
You will also play an important role developing new Product solutions with your team manager.

What we’re looking for

Problem Solving & Data Analysis: Ability to work with large data sets, perform cohort analysis and customer segmentation.
Process Optimization: It will be your responsibility to identify and implement improvements to our existing processes and policies. This includes both technical and interpersonal solutions.
People Skills: Communication is the number one priority. You will be surrounded by top talent sharing the same goals. It is crucial that you are able to communicate effectively to overcome obstacles as a team.
Project Management: Strong organizational & time management skills are key. Ability to keep track of complex migration schedules, multi stakeholders and project dependencies.
Advanced SQL & Sheets.
Basic to intermediate Python.
Why join us

Changing the restaurant industry: You’ll be part of a team that helps restaurants succeed in online food delivery.
Early-stage company: Join one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies revolutionizing the food industry
Growing market: You’ll be focused on an $80 billion market that’s projected to reach at least $500 billion by 2030 in the US alone.
Collaborative environment: You will receive support and guidance from experienced colleagues and managers, helping you to learn, grow and achieve your goals, and you’ll work closely with other teams to ensure our customer’s success.

What else you need to know

This role is based in our Barcelona office. We believe that people do their best work when they are together. As a company, we’re in the marketplace of ideas and innovation. When you’re constantly innovating, changing how an industry works, inventing new products and processes - and we are doing all these things - we believe we’re better as a team in-person. That’s why all of our teams (except for our field-based roles) are now working from one of our office locations 5 days a week.. Looking forward to sharing more about a Career of Substance at Otter.

Ready to join us as we serve those who serve others?

job description:
About the job
We are looking for Healthcare Research & Data Analyst to join our MedTech Insights team.

Clarivate’s MedTech Insights team harnesses real-world healthcare data, in-depth interviews, and our unique mix of in-house expertise to help medical device companies make some of their most important business decisions. The MedTech Insights team is an essential part of the broader MedTech team’s data-driven culture and regularly contributes its subject matter expertise to other teams within the organization.

About You– Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments

Bachelor’s degree in Science, Business Administration, Math, Statistics, or related degree, or equivalent relevant experience
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUP, INDEX match)

It would be great if you had…:

At least 1-year data analysis background from work experience or education
Strong quantitative data analysis background in science and/or business-related disciplines
Strong grasp of microeconomics and how businesses work
Ability to read and interpret income statements (understanding other financial statements is a plus)
Experience/strong interest in converting unstructured datasets into broadly usable data models
Experience/strong interest in building market forecast models
Understanding medical device markets and healthcare reimbursement are assets
Experience with SQL and/or Python

What will you be doing in this role?

You will be responsible for the production, quality, and functionality of specific content sets.
You will establish, build, and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders and customers
You’ll participate in specialist interpretation in the form of research, analysis, and writing to support the development and maintenance of Clarivate information in all media, and ensure that published information contains premium content.
You will also often participate in special projects.
You will author comprehensive market research reports that provide quantitative and qualitative insights on specific medical device markets worldwide
You’ll build market models by leveraging Clarivate’s proprietary healthcare datasets while incorporating public financial, regulatory, and government data.
Interview industry stakeholders and medical professionals to contextualize data and form insights.
You’ll understand the worldview and pain points of Clarivate clients, working closely with them as a problem-solver from Fortune 500 companies to smaller startups
You will converse with high-profile clients regularly and be expected to both present and defend conclusions to them.

About The Team

We are an international and diverse team of 45 analysts and managers located in Europe, India, and the US, making up the Medtech Insights team.
The team culture is dynamic, creative, and supportive – excellence, integrity, and care are in our DNA.
We have great benefits: 30 working days of vacations, Medical & Dental Insurance, Gym, Sodexo Card, etc
You’ll have 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time and the chance of being part of an active volunteering community which promotes diversity and inclusion across the business.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to the office in Barcelona 2-3 times per week.

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

About the job
Inycom, una empresa de innovación tecnológica con más de 40 años de experiencia en el mercado, especializada en servicios TIC y Soluciones de Negocio para nuestros clientes y de la que ya formamos parte más de 920 profesionales, continúa ampliando sus equipos de trabajo por lo que seleccionamos Analista Programador/a NET.

¿Te gustaría formar parte del mayor proyecto de sector bancario de Aragón?

Si quieres formar parte de un proyecto del que ya forman parte más de 150 profesionales y te permite el teletrabajo total o parcial según tus necesidades, este es tu lugar.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Trabajarás junto a un equipo de expertos en entornos .NET, donde además podrás tener interlocución con el cliente y en tu día a día, podrás realizar tareas de análisis y programación.

Los conocimientos técnicos generales requeridos para el puesto son:

Se valorará contar con experiencia en tecnologías como:

¿Qué te ofrecemos en el #INYCOMTEAM?

- Proyecto estable de gran alcance.

- Teletrabajo y flexibilidad.

- Horario: 41 horas semanales en invierno y jornada intensiva: 7 horas en verano (junio, julio y agosto).

¡Te esperamos en nuestro #InycomTeam!

job description:
About the job
We are currently looking for a Data Visualization to join our fast-growing team in Iberia to set of processes required to provide a solution that allows us to analyze how our business is performing. This knowledge will allow us to optimize this performance by making relevant decisions.

In this role, you will be responsible for the process of extracting, organizing, analyzing, sharing, and monitoring the information that data offers to support decision-making and business management in the healthcare world.

It will be an amazing and exciting opportunity to learn about the healthcare systems and culture and expand the solution coverage.

Do you want a job with a meaningful purpose? Do you want to make healthcare safer, better, and more reliable? Have a look at the opportunities to join our Dedalus community.

About Dedalus:

Dedalus is the leading healthcare and diagnostic software provider in Europe and one of the largest in the world with an approach focused on the continuum of care to provide complete and patient-oriented future-proof solutions to the healthcare industry.

Thanks to our portfolio of leading next-generation solutions, Dedalus covers the entire spectrum of the continuum of care, and today we support over 6,300 healthcare organizations and 5,700 labs and diagnostic centers. Our software solutions are used widely across the world, serving 540 million of population.

Today, Dedalus employs more than 6,600 highly skilled qualified people; it has the largest software R&D team in the industry in Europe representing the 38% of the overall workforce. Our company fosters a culture where employees are encouraged to learn and innovate, and to enable and enhance clinical co-operation and processes while making a meaningful difference for millions of people around the world.

We are looking for people who want to be part of our purpose-driven company and follow our vision to drive a digital-enabled healthcare ecosystem to provide better care in a healthier planet!! If you are passionate about digital technologies and want to improve healthcare delivery around the world, it is the best time to join Dedalus Spain.


About you:
Responsibilities:
Creation of ETLs
Implementation of indicators
Internal and customer data validation
Documentation

Required Skills:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or a related area of study
5-7 years experience in Data exploitation projects in the healthcare sector
2 years experience in Data exploitation projects in the healthcare sector
Ability to communicate with the client's functions
Proven experience in: health management data models; relational databases and SQL development
Visualization tool Power BI
ETL design tools (preferably Pentaho)
Desired experience in implementation of clinical processes in clinical history projects
Desired master in analytics or big data
Ability to work in a team


Why Dedalus for you?
Career development: you will have the opportunity to participate in exciting international process, have access to continuous training's programs, real internal opportunities for you to grow, and yearly performance reviews.
Healthy work and flexibility. You’ll be in a company with flexible working schedule, hybrid working style and 23 vacation days per year.
Multicultural environment in a purpose-driven company. You will work on the European market leader company in digital health to contribute to transform healthcare ecosystem though cut-edge digital technologies.
Diversity and inclusion. We work every day to leverage the richness created by diverse people and teams, where the special perspective of each individual member counts.


All our jobs are open to people with disabilities.


#WeAreDedalus#Together4Success#LifeFlowsThroughOurSoftware


Al inscribirse en esta oferta queda informado y consiente el tratamiento por parte de GRUPO DEDALUS, de los datos personales que ha facilitado voluntariamente a través de esta plataforma con la finalidad de gestionar su participación en procesos de selección (presentes o futuros).

El Usuario debe leer atentamente nuestra Política de Privacidad y el Aviso informativo para solicitantes de empleo, que ha sido redactado de forma clara y sencilla para facilitar su comprensión y están disponible en https://www.dedalus.com/spain/es/privacidad/.

En el aviso informativo para solicitantes de empleo, también podrá conocer las finalidades y plazos de conservación de los datos y cómo y dónde ejercer sus derechos de acceso, rectificación, supresión, limitación, oposición y portabilidad de los datos personales.

job description:
About the job
Acerca de Tutlo
Tutlo es una innovadora plataforma de aprendizaje de inglés con clases de conversación y sin necesidad de reservar las clases con antelación. Ya contamos con más de 32.000 estudiantes en todo el mundo, que aprenden con 60 cursos diferentes de especialización, impartidos por más de 1.100 profesores expertos y hablantes nativos.

Nos caracterizamos por ofrecer un aprendizaje basado en el desarrollo de las habilidades comunicativas en inglés y en ofrecer contenido de valor a los usuarios.

Buscamos una persona para el puesto de:
Responsable de Social Ads
Tipo: 8 horas / semana
Modalidad: Teletrabajo 100%

Responsabilidades:
Definir y diseñar la estrategia de Paid Media en la plataforma de Facebook.
Definir, diseñar e implementar campañas de Facebook Ads.
Planificar los contenidos y campañas en el calendario de eventos.
Establecer un plan de acción para la marca (definiendo los canales a utilizar, las acciones que se llevarán a cabo, el timing...).
Coordinación y supervisión de la producción para cumplir los tiempos establecidos.
Aportar al equipo de marketing innovación e ideas aplicadas a campañas de Paid.
Elaborar las presentaciones de resultados, briefings, desglose y planificación de las necesidades y tareas para la puesta en marcha de proyectos actuales y nuevos.
Alcanzar los objetivos y KPI's con los que se medirá el rendimiento de las acciones.
Elaborar el informe de métricas periódico y KPI's aportando conclusiones y propuestas de mejora.
Gestionar el presupuesto en Social Ads y plataformas asociadas.
Coordinar el proceso de creación de contenidos y materiales atractivos para los clientes (libros electrónicos, estudios e informes, testimonios, vídeos, tutoriales, podcasts, seminarios web) y su utilización en las campañas.

Requisitos
Se requiere experiencia mínima de 3 años en gestión de campañas SEM/PPC en Facebook Ads.
Experiencia previa en gestión de proyectos en agencias de marketing o startup.
Dominio en Google Analytics y analítica digital: capacidad de análisis de resultados, medición y gestió de reporting.
Alto dominio en plataformas publicitarias. Nivel experto en Facebook Ads. Se tendrá en cuenta experiencia en Tiktok Ads.
Idiomas: Nivel alto de Inglés.
Otros requisitos: Google Spreadsheets y Microsoft Excel nivel avanzado.

Además, debes tener:
Capacidad de pensamiento estratégico y analítico
Habilidades interpersonales y actitud de liderazgo
Compromiso, eficacia y determinación en la consecución de objetivos,
Capacidad de organización del trabajo
Energía positiva, iniciativa, pensamiento creativo (think out of the box), flexibilidad.

Te ofrecemos:
Una remuneración salarial acorde a tus capacidades, compromiso y trabajo diario.
Trabajo remoto 100%
Oportunidad de crecimiento profesional.
Autonomía y responsabilidad en una empresa que ya cuenta con más 1000 trabajadores en solo 7 años.
Bonus por objetivos.
Herramientas que te ayudarán a hacer cumplir los objetivos y conseguir resultados extraordinario

job description:
About the job
Sibelco is a global material solutions company. We mine, process and sell industrial minerals at locations worldwide, focused primarily on silica, clays, feldspathics and olivine. We are also leaders in glass recycling. The Sibelco Group operates over 110 production sites in 31 countries, with a team of over 5,000 people.

Click to see how Sibelco materials are used in products within and outside your home.

Location:

Bilbao HQ Office

Role Purpose:

Responsible for creating, modifying or deleting data within a specific domain (e.g. Procurement, Sales, Customer Service, Finance, Supply Chain) in accordance with company data standards and policies.

The Data Steward ensures that master data is defined according to the Data Governance policies and standards for data objects in scope.

He/she sets up data in the related applications: master and slave systems and he/she executes the data cleansing initiatives.

Responsibilities:

Challenges requests for new data creations/modifications (e.g. for completeness, duplication), accepts/rejects.
Enters data in relevant systems: ERPs etc. Assures data flows from master system to slave systems.
Produces SLAs and KPIs to ensure high performance.
Troubleshoots master data issues and resolves discrepancies.
Suggests process improvements toward data quality, accuracy and security, under the supervision of the Governor.
Suggests/Executes data cleansing initiatives.
Contributes to issue resolution across data objects.
Follows the master data maintenance process, including the control points in the process;
Guides other stakeholders in the end-to-end master data maintenance process (from requester till validator) to follow the current process, procedures and controls.

About you:

To be successful in this role you will need to:

Have excellent Excel skills
Have good knowledge of SAP Hana, Concur, Workday, Power BI
Experience in Procurement, Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, Customer Service Department
Be able to work independently
Be fluent in both written and spoken English
Be a team player and self motivated
Be Pro-active, Diplomatic and Open minded
Have strong verbal and written communication skills

But most importantly, if you embrace our core values, and if this role sparks your enthusiasm to apply your passion to contribute in a meaningful way as a part of Sibelco’s team of unique talents within a diverse international business community, then we very much look forward to hearing from you.

To Apply:

Please click apply to register your information and contact details on the recruitment portal so one of our team can get in touch.

Inclusive Team Culture: Attractive Employer (sibelco.com)

Sibelco recognises the strength of our diverse global workforce and values difference and inclusion for all. Our rich mix of people bring an exciting exchange of ideas and knowledge to keep us moving forward and innovating new solutions. We seek talent of all backgrounds and abilities and continue to develop our leaders and our culture to help all current and new employees to grow and reach their full potential.

Salary & Benefits: We will gladly discuss these aspects with you at interview stage.

Meet our People: Careers (sibelco.com)

Recruitment Process: Recruitment process (sibelco.com)

We welcome your application and will make reasonable adjustments where required to support you through the selection process.

Sibelco Targets: Sibelco priorities (sibelco.com)

We have set clearly defined sustainability priorities and targets, with key environmental and social objectives, which include Health & Safety, Climate & Energy, Community Engagement, Human Rights and Business Ethics.

Please note we have a Global Talent Acquisition Team and we will not therefore be requiring agency services

job description:
About the job
Staffing Analyst
07_Parser Staff · Hybrid, Madrid/Barcelona

This position offers you the opportunity to join a fast-growing technology organization that is redefining productivity paradigms in the software engineering industry. If you are passionate about technology and want to learn about new trends that are shaping human behavior, this opportunity is for you.

About Parser

Parser works with Clients from start-up to multinational across many verticals. The common denominator across all Clients is the need to solve fundamental business problems using technology as a means to achieve success. Their assignments are broad in nature, and varied, requiring ingenuity and innovation in the design of the solution.

We adopted agile methodologies, working in self-managed scrum teams and collaborating closely with our Clients. You will get to work alongside highly motivated and technically gifted colleagues allowing you to expand your skill-set whilst also imparting your knowledge to the broader team.



As a Staffing Analyst at Parser, you will be responsible for placing each team member in the best position at the right time, for them, for our clients, and for Parser. This role is critical to support business and professional growth, while optimizing our internal talent capacity.


The Impact You'll Make - Core Areas :

Facilitate timely assignments where both the business and our people’s interests are considered.
Collaborate with our Client Teams and other areas in identifying staffing opportunities for our Team Members.
Oversee and manage internal talent pools and Demand Openings.
Work hand-in-hand with the Talent Acquisition team, in filling open positions with external candidates.
Improve our matching process and provide visibility of the area’s main KPIs to the whole company, by keeping our reporting updated.
Learn to analyze data to provide solutions that enhance our business capacity.



What You'll Bring To Us:

From 3 to 5 years of prior work experience, ideally in the IT industry.
Understanding of technical profiles is a plus.
Ability to work with multiple projects simultaneously.
Organizational skills & analytical mindset.
Excel and Microsoft Office knowledge
Good at working with large and distributed teams.
Collaborative personality.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills both in Spanish and English.


What We'll Offer You In Return:

The chance to work in innovative projects with leading brands, that use the latest technologies that fuel transformation.
The opportunity to be part of an amazing, multicultural community of tech experts.
A competitive compensation package and medical insurance.
The opportunity to grow and develop your career with the company.
A flexible and remote working environment.
Multiple opportunities to enjoy life at Parser, with experience and engagement initiatives and perks throughout the year.
Offices located in London (UK), Barcelona, Madrid, Alicante (Spain), Lisbon (Portugal), Córdoba & Buenos Aires (Argentina), Bogotá (Colombia), with more on the way.


Come and join our #ParserCommunity.
Follow us on Linkedin

Data Specialist / BI Analyst

Location: Madrid, Spain

(This role is office based in the Mindray Madrid office Monday to Friday / full time)

Highly Competitive Salary + Excellent Benefits + Career Enhancement

Reporting to National Operations Manager, Spain

Are you a data guru, fluent in Spanish and English (and preferably Mandarin, but not essential!), well versed in BI tools, data analysis, business performance and reporting looking to have immediate impact on a business in exponential growth – if so, we have a newly created opportunity you will love! To achieve our ambitious growth targets, we have fostered a culture of data driven innovation and product development.

Working with our highly successful Spanish team, based in Madrid, you will have outstanding commercial analytical skills, a comprehensive working experience of tools such as Tableau, or similar BI tools and will join our fun, highly professional, experienced team, to truly shape how we use our data to the fullest. job description:
About the job
Clarity AI’s mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.

We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are currently looking for a Data Strategy Manager to support our team for a temporary period of about, 6 months.

The role provides an opportunity to contribute to the mission of Clarity while working in a multicultural, flexible, and fast-paced environment.

LOCATION
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Do the quarterly reporting to data vendors by using Salesforce
Support to legal on data rights: you will support our team on all the questions related to data rights, and you will be in close collaboration with our legal team to asses them in the best way
Ongoing conversations with Data Providers: you will play a key role in the discussions with our different data providers
Establishes and develops trusted partnerships and relationships
Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads, service managers, and owners
Understands how in-depth analysis of voluminous datasets enables the discovery of new insight that improves decision-making processes and operational effectiveness
Collaborate with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done. You will use your influence skills to establish a strong sense of working together towards a shared vision and goals.
Engage business leaders/staff and technology leaders/staff in an end-to-end process to understand and communicate data management capabilities to support solutions
Apply problem-solving techniques to determine business impact and strategic option


Requirements:
Business or Engineering Degree
At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Ability to read and understand contracts with Data Vendors
Understand how contracts affect the products
Propose solutions to the requests that allow to remain compliant and address the business need
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Strong communication skills, with proven negotiation skills


Benefits:
Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:
Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.
Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.
We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).
Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.
Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).
To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.
By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.
We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.
ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
Additional benefits are available depending on your location.
We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.

Clarity has received several awards:
World Economic Forum Pioneer
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab
Top startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent
Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017

Privacy Policy
Responsibility: Clarity AI Inc. 160 Greentree Drive, Suite 101, City of Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19904, United States.
Purpose: management of selection processes for new employees.
Legitimation: necessary processing for contract execution.
Recipients: company of the Clarity Group in the country that would carry out the contract or where position is being offered.
Rights: the interested party may exercise the rights of access, rectification, opposition, limitation, suppression, portability and not to be the object of automated decisions according to the Privacy Policy.
More info: to consult the privacy policy in detail, click on the following link (Privacy Policy)

job description:
About the job
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.
What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.

Act as the key business support for the dedicated business units with revenue budgeting, forecasting, reporting, pricing, and profitability projects. Responsibility for Iberia

Position purpose:
Prepare monthly management reporting packages per product & country with relevant management commentary
Prepare country pack presentations
Partner with Country General Managers and Commercial Teams in evaluating new business opportunities in dedicated business units
Supporting the adoption of standard finance tools and processes
Combining FP&A data analytics with business insights to produce accurate budgets and forecasts and clearly measure and communicate performance against these
Perform customer profitability review
Analyze and identify the reasons for variations
Control and analysis of direct costs of dedicated business units.
Participation in current department projects and other tasks

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance / Business Administration or equivalent.

Experience:

3+ years of Finance experience preferably for complex multinational businesses, with Commercial and Supply Chain Finance expertise


Skills and Knowledge
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Established financial, commercial and strategic analysis skills
Base level financial modeling skills (DCF Analysis, scenario analysis, business case development, business valuations, and operational modelling)
Commercial acumen with demonstrated strength in solving both structured and unstructured problems
Advanced Word / Excel / PowerPoint skills
Exceptional interpersonal skills to enable the effective management of stakeholders
Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively to deadlines and without supervision
English and Spanish.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to developing a diverse workforce in which everyone is treated fairly, with respect, and has the opportunity to contribute to business success while realizing his or her potential. This means harnessing the unique skills and experience that each individual brings and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

Individuals fraudulently misrepresenting themselves as Brambles or CHEP representatives have scheduled interviews and offered fraudulent employment opportunities with the intent to commit identity theft or solicit money. Brambles and CHEP never conduct interviews via online chat or request money as a term of employment. If you have a question as to the legitimacy of an interview or job offer, please contact us at recruitment@brambles.com.

job description:
About the job
JR0114179

Data Analysis - Product Performance Associate ) – Madrid, Spain

Are you ready to play a pivotal role using your analytical skills to ensure growth and success across our Financial Ecosystem in Europe? Do you have a passion for innovation and for using data to drive commercial success? If so, why not consider joining Western Unions’ new Digital Banking hub as a Data Analysis - Product Performance Associate .

Western Union powers your pursuit.

In this unique role for the new pan-European Ecosystem you will play a critical role in ensuring the success of our digital banking product by tracking and analyzing performance metrics, identifying trends and opportunities for improvement, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive product optimization.

Role Responsibilities
Using a wide range of data, you will be identifying trends and insights to inform product optimization and growth strategies.
You will collaborate with Product Management Team to establish performance metrics and KPIs for our digital banking product.
You will work with cross-functional teams, including product, marketing, and technology, to identify and prioritize product improvements and enhancements.
You will conduct market research and competitor analysis to stay up to date with industry trends and best practices.
You will communicate product performance insights and recommendations to key stakeholders and partners, and you will have an active role in the product reporting cycles.
Role Requirements
For this important role you will have 5+ years of professional experience in data analysis, performance analysis or a related field, although candidates with other relevant experience will be considered.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience using data to inform decision-making.
You have excellent communication and collaboration skills and the ability to work independently and in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
=
You demonstrate experience with mobile and web tools, and experience in digital banking propositions, market trends, and the competitve landscape.
A strong academic background including qualifications (or equivalence in experience) in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing or Technology, or a related field is advantageous.
Excellent written and spoken English and Spanish are essential and all other language skills are welcomed.
We make financial services accessible to humans everywhere. Join us for what’s next.

Western Union is positioned to become the world’s most accessible financial services company —transforming lives and communities. To support this, we have launched a Digital Banking Service and Wallet across several European markets to enhance our customers’ experiences by offering a state-of-the-art digital Ecosystem. More than moving money, we design easy-to-use products and services for our digital and physical financial ecosystem that help our customers move forward.

Just as we help our global customers prosper, we support our employees in achieving their professional aspirations. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as receive a great compensation package. If you’re ready to help drive the future of financial services, it’s time for Western Union. Learn more about our purpose and people at https://careers.westernunion.com/

Benefits

You will also have access to short-term incentives, multiple health insurance options, accident and life insurance, and access to best-in-class development platforms, to name a few

(https://careers.westernunion.com/global-benefits/). Please see the location-specific benefits below and note that your Recruiter may share additional role-specific benefits during your interview process or in an offer of employment.

Your Spain Specific Benefits Include
25 days annual leave – plus 14 public holidays
Comprehensive life & medical cover – including dependents.
Contributory pension plan
Preventative Care Assistance program

job description:
About the job
Description

Clarity AI’s mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.
We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for an Associate - Data Research that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies’ ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies’ sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION:
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working as an Associate - Data Research you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python
Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)
Mentor and train external contractors and internal team on environmental indicators and sustainability frameworks
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed


Requirements:
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
At least a Bachelor’s degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study
2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)
Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)
Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets
Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact

*Only CVs in English will be taken into account

#Greattech needs #GreatPeople like you.
