job description:
About the job
Ingersoll Rand is committed to achieving workforce diversity reflective of our communities. We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Posición Objetivo
Buscamos un/una Analista de soporte de aplicaciones para nuestro departamento de Gestión de productos. Ubicada en nuestro centro de trabajo en Coslada, la persona seleccionada supervisará la instalación y el mantenimiento de aplicaciones de software IoT (internet de las cosas) con el fin de agilizar las operaciones comerciales. Incluyendo la optimización del rendimiento de las aplicaciones de software IoT Edge y Cloud y la realización de procedimientos de depuración.
Además, apoyará al soporte de primera línea y a los ingenieros y equipos de desarrollo con problemas de soporte de aplicaciones y monitorizará de cerca los sistemas clave que reaccionan a los incidentes de manera proactiva.

Responsabilidades clave:
Mantenimiento de la plataforma personalizada de front-end
Creación y mantener documentación funcional
Realizar pruebas de aplicaciones
Identificación y replicación de problemas de software proporcionando en su caso una solución provisional al problema.
Proporcionar soporte a través del sistema de ticketing, correo electrónico y teléfono
Proporcionará formación y apoyo a nuestro personal interno y distribuidores
Servirá de enlace con empresas de terceros para cumplir con los requisitos comerciales
Investigación y diagnóstico de fallos y errores del sistema
Soporte a los clientes en cuanto a la configuración y operación de los productos.
Colaborar con las pruebas de nuevas versiones de software.
Mantenimiento y actualización de problemas de clientes tras un lanzamiento de software.
Mantener y mejorar el conocimiento del software.
Reporte del progreso de las actividades en curso al Gerente de Soporte.
Comunicación de fallos detectados y su solución a otros miembros del equipo de Soporte e Implementación.
Recomendación al Gerente de mejoras a la operación de soporte.
Administración de tarifas de datos (dispositivos edge sim)
Mantenimiento de cuentas de clientes (portal en la nube)

Cualificación :
Grado (Licenciatura) en Ingeniería informática.

Competencias clave:
Experiencia probada como analista de soporte de aplicaciones con experiencia de dos a cuatro años.
Experiencia con la aplicación Microsoft Office
Se requiere experiencia y comprensión de la programación de software (por ejemplo, JavaScript, C#, Python)
Conocimiento moderado o avanzado de la creación/ejecución de API (interfaz de programación de aplicaciones).
Dominio del inglés; se valorarán otros idiomas europeos, ya que prestará apoyo a una red mundial.
Atención a los detalles y habilidades para resolver problemas
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita
Fuertes habilidades organizativas con la capacidad de realizar múltiples tareas
Capacidad de transmitir información técnica a usuarios no técnicos y obtener las necesidades de los clientes
Orientación al cliente y con capacidad para trabajar con plazos.
Autónomo pero con gran capacidad de trabajo en equipo
Actitud proactiva
Disponibilidad para viajar hasta un 30% del tiempo total.

¿Que ofrecemos?
Te ofrecemos un trabajo interesante lleno de retos en una compañia multinacional trabajando con un gran equipo,
Beneficios sociales y posibilidad de teletrabajo acorde a la política de la compañia.

Position Objective
Reporting to Product Manager Services and Digital ITS Europe, Located in our workcenter in Coslada, we are looking for an Application support analyst to oversee the installation and maintenance of IoT (internet of things) software applications in order to streamline business operations. Including optimizing IoT Edge and Cloud software application performance and performing debugging procedures.
You will provide support to the first line support and engineers and development teams with application support issues and closely monitor key systems reacting to incidents in a pro-active manner.

Key Responsibilities:
Maintain front end bespoke platform
Create and maintain functional documentation
Conduct and document application testing
Identification and replication of software problems and where appropriate, provide an interim solution to the problem.
Provide support via ticketing system, email and phone
To provide training and support to our internal staff and distributors
Liaising with third party companies to fulfil business requirements
Investigating and diagnosing system faults and errors
Provide support to customers concerning the configuration and operation of products.
Assist with testing of new software releases.
Maintenance and update of customer problems following a software release.
Maintain and improve knowledge of software.
Reporting of progress of ongoing activities to the Support Manager.
Communication of known faults and their work around to other members of the Support & Implementation team.
Recommendation to the Manager of improvements to the support operation.
Administration of data tariffs (edge sim devices)
Customer account maintenance (cloud portal)

Qualifications
Proven experience as an Application support analyst
Degree (Bachelor) in Computer/Software sciences desirable

Key Competencies:
Proficient in English Language
Attention to detail and problem solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills both written and verbal
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
The ability to relay technical information to non-technical users and elicit clients' needs
Customer service skills
Attention to detail
The ability to work independently but also as a part of a team
A proactive attitude
Ability to work to deadlines and give realistic estimates
Willingness to learn.
Travel Requirements (percentage): 30%

¿What are we offering?
You will find an interesting work full of challenges in a multinational company working with a great team!

Social Benefits And Teleworking Under Our Company Policy.
Ingersoll Rand Inc. (NYSE:IR), driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and ownership mindset, is dedicated to helping make life better for our employees, customers and communities. Customers lean on us for our technology-driven excellence in mission-critical flow creation and industrial solutions across 40+ respected brands where our products and services excel in the most complex and harsh conditions. Our employees develop customers for life through their daily commitment to expertise, productivity and efficiency. For more information, visit www.IRCO.com.

job description:
About the job
Desde Prosegur buscamos un Digital Marketing Data Analyst para nuestro Departamento de Marketing corporativo ubicado en Madrid, donde contarás con modelo híbrido de trabajo (compaginando teletrabajo con asistencia a la oficina).


¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?
Análisis de los resultados, seguimiento y monitorización de los KPIs digitales e identificación de oportunidades de mejora de rendimiento de los distintos canales
Elaboración de informes regulares y ad hoc que a nivel corporativo y de negocio se establezcan, en base a estrategias de marketing digital y mejoras en el impacto de consecución de leads.
Planteamiento y medición completa de todos los sites corporativos, incluyendo definición de criterios de medición, guías de etiquetado, etc.
Definición e implementación del stack tecnológico que soporte la activación y reporting de campañas digitales, incluidos un data Layer robusto en todos los sites
Tratamiento de datos de diferentes fuentes internas y externas (CRMs, CallCenter, Analítica, etc.)
Conocimiento de soluciones enfocadas a encontrar soluciones relativas a los nuevos ecosistemas cookie-less
Planteamiento y desarrollo de soluciones que mejoren la trazabilidad y explotación de datos en un ecosistema de lead generation.
Colaboración con los equipos IT y Legal para asegurar el correcto tratamiento de los datos a nivel técnico y de privacidad.
Definición y constante evolución de diferentes modelos de atribución (incluido Data-Driven)



¿Qué buscamos?
3-5 años de experiencia en Analítica Digital.
Conocimiento en taggeado e implementaciones de Google Analytics o similar. Se valorará positivamente haber migrado o trabajado con el nuevo paradigma de Google Analytics (GA4)
Manejo de gestores de Etiquetas: Tag Manager.
Manejo de Google DataStudio, PowerBI
Manejo de algún CMP de mercado (OneTrust/LiveRamp/Didomi/etc.)
Se valorará positivamente el conocimiento de soluciones tales como: Consent Mode y Serve-side tagging, Conversiones mejoradas.
Conocimiento de todo el stack tecnológico de Google Marketing Platform
Conocimiento técnico de otras plataformas de activación: Facebook, LinkedIn…
Conocimiento de plataformas Cloud (Azure y Google). Valorado especialmente conocimiento en BigQuery.
Valorable conocimientos básicos de javascript, HTML, SQL, parametrización
Inglés nivel alto


¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Formar parte de un equipo internacional (con presencia en 26 países)
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico con un excelente ambiente laboral
Participar en proyectos estratégicos y disruptivos
Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur
Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales a través de Reflex
Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar
Colaborar con nuestra Fundación para crear una sociedad más justa
Dar vida a tus ideas en nuestro Programa Global de Innovación e Intraemprendimiento

Nuestro Propósito y nuestros Valores
“Cuidar de las personas y empresas para hacer del mundo un lugar más seguro, manteniéndonos a la vanguardia de la innovación” es lo que nos motiva desde hace más de 40 años.
Y lo hacemos utilizando las tecnologías más punteras (IA, IoT, Data Science, Blockchain, etc.) para ofrecer soluciones disruptivas a través de nuestras cinco líneas de negocio: Security, Cash, Alarms, Cipher y AVOS.
Nuestros más de 150.000 profesionales presentes en 26 países nos han convertido en un referente en el sector de la seguridad y nos ayudan cada día a mantener y compartir nuestros valores: Nos importan las personas, pensamos en positivo y somos imparables.

¿Y tú? ¿Te sientes identificad@ con nuestro propósito? Súmate a nuestro Team of Teams aplicando a esta oferta y comienza tu aventura con nosotros.
skills: Capacidad de análisis, Analítica, and SQL

job description:
About the job
To empower our Funnels Performance Team, we are looking for a talented Digital Analyst to help the company with all their digital strategies.

We are WIRIS, a software development company founded 20 years ago and headquartered in Barcelona with offices in the USA, and Long Beach (California) since we acquired Design Science company in 2017. Over the past few years, we’ve been named “The Makers of MathType”, and our mission is to make people's STEM work more meaningful by creating software with deep knowledge of advanced technology and science.

We are currently more than 80 people revolutionizing the educational field with innovative products that are continuously growing, enhancing our value proposition for our global customers such as NASA, Blackboard, Moodle, Yale University, and Pearson among others.

To find out more about our culture and values, you can take a look at our Instagram account: @lifeatwiris

Key responsibilities

Lead our digital measurement strategy and marketing funnel definition for all products to track their performance, user behavior and improve the conversion rate.
Be responsible for digital products tag implementations through Google Tag Manager.
Set Google Analytics 4 configuration in order to get the best insights from the collected data.
Work with other teams to make sure the digital strategy meets all the business requirements (product, paid ads, store…).
Track funnel KPIs using Google Analytics 4, Salesforce, and other visualization tools to support decision-making. You will have to turn company data into actionable business analysis and meaningful insights.
Analysis and evaluation of promotions, providing results and conclusions to main stakeholders.
Monitor that all tools are working properly and solve any incidents that may arise to ensure the maintenance of the measurement structure.
Participate in the definition and monitoring of digital business objectives, by acquiring a global vision of the company's challenges.
Identify, propose, and implement new measurement strategies or tools that can provide value to our current digital strategy.

Requirements

A data-driven mindset with a focus on real-time performance optimization.
1-2 years of experience in web analytics or product analytics.
Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics 3 or 4 and its implementation.
Advanced knowledge of Google Tag Manager configuration.
Experience in implementing a full digital measurement strategy, including session data, events, and enhanced e-commerce.
Understanding of the marketing funnel optimization and how online marketing works (KPIs, different channels…).
Fluent in Spanish and English.
Ability to organize and crunch data, interpret metrics and identify insights and trends.

We offer

Full-time permanent position.
Competitive salary + optional flex salary plan.
Flexible working hours and a hybrid work environment.
Private health insurance.
Birthday day off, in addition to your vacation days off
Unlimited access to Udemy Business.
In-house English and Spanish lessons to improve your knowledge.
A great work environment in Barcelona city center.
All the coffee you can drink, fresh fruit, and yogurt.

If you consider your profile matches our requirements, this is your moment! Apply now and join us in this new challenge!

Wiris is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We aim to create a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our employees, customers, and users. Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitment, our curiosity, how we collaborate, and the ways that we courageously share our perspectives and encourage others to do the same.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant from underrepresented minorities, persons with disabilities, sexual minority groups, and other candidates who may contribute to the diversification and enrichment of ideas and perspectives.

job description:
About the job
Location: Madrid alcobendas, Madrid, Spain

Job ID: 68814

We Elevate… You

Join Schindler and help us elevate our world: Use your skills to allow megacities to grow. With our elevators and escalators, we keep the urban world moving.

Since 1874 Schindler has been a Citymaker with proud reputation for elevating not only buildings, but the well-being of everyone who lives and works in them. People, passion, and innovation are the pillars of our success.

Join us as a

Digital Analytics Specialist

We Elevate... Your Responsibilities

Schindler is looking for a Digital Analytics Specialist for its Global Reporting Solutions (GRS) team. As a BI Consultant, you will be building up strong Schindler business process knowledge to create impactful reports for our field management so that they can lead with data insights. You will be organizing your scrum team in close coordination with the product owner and scrum master. You will be gathering requirements and designing best-in-class Power BI reports in collaboration with experts from different parts of our business. You will be reporting to the CoE Digital Analytics Team Lead in Madrid and be part of the Global Reporting Solutions (GRS) of Schindler based in Ebikon, Switzerland.

We are looking for a people-minded technologist, who is passionate about analytics & reporting, comfortable with driving change, a solid problem-solver, with proven ability to operate and deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, all the while meeting our high-quality standards. Candidates need a well-rounded background to balance the line between IT and the business.

You will mainly be responsible for the following tasks:
Design new impactful reports in co-creation for our management cockpit together with global business and lead users in design thinking sessions, considering data model and Power BI capabilities
Manage the backlog of your scrum team by breaking apart and prioritizing requirements so that your team can ship value every sprint
Lead your functional team, which constitutes of several developers and a data modeler by defining clear sprint goals and sprint backlogs
Demo your new or enhanced reports to gather user feedback so that we ensure usefulness and impact of our solutions
Test the functionality of your reports and collaborate with the quality assurance specialist in your team to match the expected results
Support the business change manager of our global team in the worldwide roll-out of your reports by enhancing the reports to match evolving user expectations

We Elevate... Your Best Self

Furthermore, you possess the following experience:
At least 2-3 years of experience in various BI projects with solid knowledge in one of the leading BI tools (e.g. Power BI, Qlik or Tableau) for data analytics, visualizations, reporting. Knowledge of Power BI is a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in business administration or engineering.
Full BI lifecycle experience (from requirement to report).
Strong problem solver and ability to translate business needs to impactful reports.
Evangelist for change management and driving digitalization within a multinational environment.
SAP knowledge (in one or more modules: FICO/MM, SD, Contracts) is a plus.
Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environment.
Highly organized; able to structure and manage large quantities of complex information. Knowledge of Confluence and Jira software is a plus.
Fluency in English and proactive communication effectively with all levels of staff and management.

We Elevate... You
Flexible compensation plan

Childcare vouchers, car rental, health insurance with benefits for your family members, restauant vouchers... Save money with the flexible remuneration and its tax advantages!
Flexible hours

enter between 7:30 am and 9:30 am and leave between 05:00 pm and 07:00 pm. Is there a lot of traffic in the mornings after dropping the children off at school or are you an early riser to make the most of the day? Organize it the way you want with our flexible schedule!
Vacations

You will enjoy a continuous working day in the summer, and how many things can you do in almost a month? if you don't know, start thinking about it! here you have almost 1 month of annual vacation! Also, think about what you are going to do in the summer evenings because here you will have them free!
Online training in technology and languages

Do you want to get certified in your new favorite technology? Do you prefer to learn a new language? at Schindler you have online training for this, 100% subsidized by the company.
Medical insurance 100% subsidized

job description:
About the job
TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. Accommodation Sourcing is a global team within TUI technology responsible for the connectivity and sourcing of hotel and accommodation portfolio. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.

At TUI we’re ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.


We never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.


The Business Analyst is a critical thinker with a keen eye for detail. Actively consulting with stakeholders, probing to create and communicate a common understanding of the problem that needs solving. Working within a fast-paced agile environment, the Business Analyst thinks outside of the box, loves collaborating across teams and is a lifelong learner.

The Business Analyst in the supplier connectivity environment is a primarily a technical role. A general technical understanding of data exchange via APIs is required as well as reading and working with technical data exchange formats. The specification and design of data models and the data flow between different micro services as well as the mapping of business-related data is one of the core tasks for the Business Analyst.

ABOUT THE JOB:

As a Business Analyst, you are part of a cross-functional team that delivers micro service driven backend solutions from conception to operation. You will collaborate with business analysts, software developers, architects, stakeholder, business partners and tech experts to clearly define, document and communicate requirements that will enable implementation of new changes and enhancements to our digital platforms in an agile manner.

You’re responsible for evaluating solution options, consulting with stakeholders as needed to define and articulate business needs in a way that enables the design and delivery of technical solutions that add value across TUI global platforms and services. You use your deep understanding of TUI products and systems, business models, processes, data flows and their link to business capabilities to plan and deliver high quality business analysis that supports the ongoing delivery of growth and digital transformation across our key markets.

Working alongside a varied set of technology and business stakeholders, you define and document new business, user, and system requirements, considering impacts to upstream/ downstream services. You manage the requirement lifecycle from planning through to elicitation, testing, delivery, and business acceptance. You can provide business analysis to multiple scrum-oriented delivery teams and work closely with the technology lead to prioritise and manage complex backlogs.

As a Business Analyst you distil the needs of business and using your strong collaboration skills you support your team to deliver the best solutions to our customers’ needs. You are commercially astute, focusing on solving business problems in the best way.

You love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for excellence, ownership and self-organisation at team and personal level.  You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas. You’re an active member in the Business Analyst community.

Security is part of everyone’s job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.

ABOUT YOU:

Strong analytical skills and commercial acumen. Adept at understanding complex problems and communicating findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Collaborative approach, able to balance the needs of multiple stakeholders and facilitate agreement across multiple markets in a global structure
Proficient at using requirements elicitation methods including business process modelling (BPM), UML, test/use cases and prototyping
Experience creating, analysing and validating detailed functional specifications and elements of systems design; including data rules, data models, data flow processes, business rules, wireframes or other detailed deliverables that articulate how a business need should be satisfied
Good track record of successfully using requirements elicitation and communication techniques including workshop facilitation, documentation analysis, interviewing and brainstorming
Good Knowledge of technical data exchange formats like JSON, XML and YAML
Experience with technical API-technologies like REST and SOAP and corresponding tools like Postman
Knowledge of touristic data formats like EDF and OTA would be helpful
Familiar with database queries (SQL), micro service architecture and AWS services
Demonstrable experience of creating user stories, epics and acceptance criteria/scenarios within a scrum-oriented environment
A good understanding of agile and flexible software delivery methodology, tools and techniques and the software development lifecycle including knowledge of Scrum and Kanban
Customer centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services
Passionate about continuous improvement
Open minded, inquisitive, life-long learner
Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous

About Our Offer

Competitive salary
Pension scheme and life assurance
Generous holiday entitlement & holiday discounts
Forward thinking ways of working
TUI time off, purchase of additional holiday entitlement
Excellent rates with foreign exchange and discounts with retailers

We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA

If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email recruitment@tui.co.uk

job description:
About the job
Somos un grupo energético multinacional e innovador, presente en más de 20 países. Nos dedicamos a la generación, distribución y comercialización de energía y servicios, comprometidos con el bienestar de las personas, el progreso de empresas y sociedad, y la sostenibilidad del planeta.

El negocio de Comercialización desafía el reto del crecimiento; despuntando en competitividad, reinventando la relación con el cliente, acelerando la digitalización y la generación distribuida para impulsar la energía renovable.
Necesitamos personas de acción, con ganas de aprender, sin miedo y con entusiasmo para evolucionar mirando al futuro.

¡Queremos ser los mejores en lo que hacemos! Trabajando en equipo, haciendo más con menos y desarrollando a cada persona, para crecer juntos tanto en el ámbito comercial como en el de otros negocios, gracias a las oportunidades de movilidad interna del grupo Naturgy.
¿Te apuntas al desafío?
En este contexto buscamos talento para la posición de Data Analyst Sector Energético
Como Data Analyst Sector Energético serás parte de este reto ilusionante donde los datos están en la base de las decisiones de negocio orientadas a la consecución de los objetivos estratégicos de la compañía, en diversos ámbitos de la comercialización de energía y servicios energéticos.
Los retos de tu día a día estarán orientados a:
Desarrollo y generación de procesos ETL para la carga y transformación de la información origen, permitiendo la creación de informes.
Realización de análisis avanzados que faciliten la toma de decisiones, desde la propuesta de requerimientos hasta la presentación de resultados.
Identificación y generación de variables sintéticas asegurando la coherencia en las extracciones entre las diferentes fuentes de información de la compañía.
Automatización de procesos con herramientas de perfil DevOps (AWS Lambdas, Azure Functions ,Git, Athena, …).
Utilización de herramientas de query/reporting, creación de informes y consultas a bases de datos con SAS, SQL, Power BI, QuickSight.
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos predictivos y su explotación en entornos cloud para su consumo (Sagemaker AWS, Glue Jobs,..).
Lo que necesitas:
Requisitos Obligatorios
Titulación: Grado superior en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Ingeniería, ADE, Física o Física Aplicada.
Tener conocimiento de lenguaje de programación orientadas a BBDD (SQL, PL-SQL, SAS) y para análisis estadísticos (Python, SAS, R).
Habilidades obligatorias en herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, QuickSight).
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en análisis de data.
Habilidades para la comunicación y presentación de datos de manera efectiva, para que los análisis puedan ser comprendidos y utilizados por personas que no son expertas en datos. Esto incluye diseñas informes y dashboards en equipo con otros departamentos de la empresa.
Idiomas: Inglés (mínimo C1).
Requisitos Valorables
Conocimiento del sector energético
Experiencia en proyectos con tecnología Cloud (Azure, AWS).
Valorable un segundo idioma.
Lo que ofrecemos
Trabajar en un equipo colaborativo y multidisciplinar.
Ambiente que promueve la diversidad e igualdad.
Programa formativo y de desarrollo.
Compromiso con la conciliación y la flexibilidad, con formato de trabajo híbrido.
Espíritu innovador en un entorno retador y motivador.
Networking y trabajo en equipo con ubicación en Madrid.
¿Te apuntas al desafío?
1) Rellena el formulario con tus datos. Para completar el perfil, te recomendamos adjuntar tu CV actualizado y certificado de inglés.
2) Si cumples el perfil contactaremos contigo para participar en las diferentes pruebas y entrevistas.
3) Si avanzas con éxito en el proceso ¡te damos la bienvenida al equipo Naturgy!

¡Inscríbete y atrévete a impulsar tu energía y acelerar tu futuro con Naturgy!

job description:
About the job
Clarity AI’s mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.

We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are currently looking for a Data Strategy Manager to support our team for a temporary period of about, 6 months.

The role provides an opportunity to contribute to the mission of Clarity while working in a multicultural, flexible, and fast-paced environment.

LOCATION
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Do the quarterly reporting to data vendors by using Salesforce
Support to legal on data rights: you will support our team on all the questions related to data rights, and you will be in close collaboration with our legal team to asses them in the best way
Ongoing conversations with Data Providers: you will play a key role in the discussions with our different data providers
Establishes and develops trusted partnerships and relationships
Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads, service managers, and owners
Understands how in-depth analysis of voluminous datasets enables the discovery of new insight that improves decision-making processes and operational effectiveness
Collaborate with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done. You will use your influence skills to establish a strong sense of working together towards a shared vision and goals.
Engage business leaders/staff and technology leaders/staff in an end-to-end process to understand and communicate data management capabilities to support solutions
Apply problem-solving techniques to determine business impact and strategic option


Requirements:
Business or Engineering Degree
At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Ability to read and understand contracts with Data Vendors
Understand how contracts affect the products
Propose solutions to the requests that allow to remain compliant and address the business need
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Strong communication skills, with proven negotiation skills


Benefits:
Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:
Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.
Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.
We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).
Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.
Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).
To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.
By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.
We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.
ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
Additional benefits are available depending on your location.
We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.

Clarity has received several awards:
World Economic Forum Pioneer
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab
Top startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent
Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017

Privacy Policy
Responsibility: Clarity AI Inc. 160 Greentree Drive, Suite 101, City of Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19904, United States.
Purpose: management of selection processes for new employees.
Legitimation: necessary processing for contract execution.
Recipients: company of the Clarity Group in the country that would carry out the contract or where position is being offered.
Rights: the interested party may exercise the rights of access, rectification, opposition, limitation, suppression, portability and not to be the object of automated decisions according to the Privacy Policy.
More info: to consult the privacy policy in detail, click on the following link (Privacy Policy)

job description:
About the job
Tienes espíritu emprendedor, iniciativa y pasión por la tecnología? ¿Te motivan los proyectos innovadores? ¿Te guía el desarrollo de las personas? ¿Te define una actitud positiva? Si quieres hacer tuya nuestra organización, tener la responsabilidad y el compromiso de llevarla más allá, te recomendamos que sigas leyendo.

Queremos ampliar nuestro equipo en España para realizar tareas de DATA ENGINEER. Buscamos personas con experiencia de al menos 5 años, con iniciativa, sentido de compromiso, apertura a la experiencia y buena actitud que tengan ganas de sumarse a un proyecto humano, innovador y estratégico.

Nuestro modelo de organización promueve una cultura diversa, donde tenemos claro que el todo es más que la suma de las partes. Apostamos por ser una empresa inclusiva, que promueve el equilibrio entre mujeres y hombres, como en la igualdad de las condiciones laborales. Fomentando la diversidad de cultura, edad y conocimiento.

¿Quieres saber cuál sería tu propósito?

Interpretar los datos para establecer estrategias que permitan tomar decisiones de calado.

¿Cuáles serian tus tareas?

- Experiencia en análisis e interpretación de modelos de datos.
-Experiencia con herramienta Talend
- Programación de ETL con conocimientos sólidos de SQL
-Experiencia en herramientas de visualización de datos: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, etc.

Sería valorable:
- Programación en python
- Experiencia en minería de procesos


¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚩

Empresa en crecimiento continuo, con gran transversalidad de roles que fomentan un entorno de aprendizaje constante y oportunidades de crecimiento.
Salario por categoría.
Opciones de trabajo flexibles.

Somos 👋

En Nae llevamos casi 20 años desarrollando proyectos de telecomunicaciones por todo el mundo, somos la consultora telco en la que nos atrevemos a ir más allá, ¿te atreves a acompañarnos?

Nuestro modelo de organización promueve una cultura diversa, donde tenemos claro que el todo es más que la suma de las partes. Apostamos por ser una empresa inclusiva en la que todas las personas pueden participar en igualdad de condiciones. #DareToGoBeyond


¿Te atreves?

job description:
About the job
Desde Prosegur buscamos incorporar una persona para el equipo de Flota a las oficinas centrales de Madrid con un modelo híbrido de trabajo.

¿Qué funciones vas a realizar?
Gestión de solicitudes y mantenimiento de cartera de pedidos
Recibir las solicitudes internas de necesidades de flota, evaluar la manera óptima de proporcionar una solución de movilidad, y planificar con las empresas de renting las entregas de vehículos.
Mantener y estructurar la cartera de pedidos.
Recopilar y organizar la documentación necesaria para gestionar los pedidos y asegurar que todas las gestiones se realizan de acuerdo a los procedimientos determinados por la empresa.
Análisis y control de flota
Extraer datos relativos a la flota actual, analizar la información y realizar propuestas para optimizar el volumen y uso de los vehículos.
Gestión de proveedores y clientes internos
Servir como punto de contacto de los diferentes interlocutores del departamento, recibiendo sus solicitudes y colaborando para proporcionar soluciones.


¿Qué buscamos de ti?
Principalmente queremos incorporar a personas comprometidas, con alta atención al detalle y con muchas ganas de aprender en un entorno retador como Prosegur. Además:
Experiencia previa de al menos 2 años en el negocio de renting de vehículos.
Necesario nivel avanzado en Excel.
Valorable inglés nivel alto.

¿Qué ofrecemos?
Formar parte de un equipo internacional (con presencia en 26 países)
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico con un excelente ambiente laboral
Participar en proyectos estratégicos y disruptivos
Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur
Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales a través de Reflex
Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar
Colaborar con nuestra Fundación para crear una sociedad más justa
Dar vida a tus ideas en nuestro Programa Global de Innovación e Intraemprendimiento


Nuestro Propósito y nuestros Valores
“Cuidar de las personas y empresas para hacer del mundo un lugar más seguro, manteniéndonos a la vanguardia de la innovación” es lo que nos motiva desde hace más de 40 años.
Y lo hacemos utilizando las tecnologías más punteras (IA, IoT, Data Science, Blockchain, etc.) para ofrecer soluciones disruptivas a través de nuestras cinco líneas de negocio: Security, Cash, Alarms, Cipher y AVOS.
Nuestros más de 150.000 profesionales presentes en 26 países nos han convertido en un referente en el sector de la seguridad y nos ayudan cada día a mantener y compartir nuestros valores: Nos importan las personas, pensamos en positivo y somos imparables.

¿Y tú? ¿Te sientes identificad@ con nuestro propósito? Súmate a nuestro Team of Teams aplicando a esta oferta y comienza tu aventura con nosotros.

job description:
About the job
Do you really want the perfect job? 🧐 Or do you want the next step in your career to be deeply impactful? I can’t offer you perfect, but I can offer deep impact. 💪 I have a successful 11-year-old SaaS product that needs awesome skillsets (maybe yours?) to reach new heights. 🧗 As a team we’re killing it in DE for our niche, but we have a lofty road map ahead of us (#disruptUSA) 💥 and a bus with a few key seats 🤩 we still need to fill.

Still reading? Awesome. Let me intro myself, hi my name is Remo. I’m the co-founder of ProvenExpert. You will be working closely with me; therefore, I want to give you context on us, what the role is about and what we’re looking for.

Me and my colleagues are fighting for the little (wo)man – the small business owners and one-(wo)man-bands who grind each and every day to master their craft. They want to focus on delivering outstanding work and getting more clients – not sales and marketing. That’s where we come in as ProvenExpert – we provide a SaaS platform for small business owners to manage feedback and enable them to direct their online reputation.

Are you ready for a challenging and exciting career in the world of data? 🌐 Do you want to help shape the future of our reputation management platforms while working closely with our talented team? Then we are looking for exactly you! We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer (m/f/d) to help us optimize our data infrastructure and develop innovative solutions for our customers. As a Data Engineer (m/f/d) at ProvenExpert, you will play a critical role in driving our data strategy and ensuring data quality and availability for our teams and customers. You will work closely with various departments to understand their requirements and develop customized solutions to support the success of our business.

Tasks

Where your expertise is needed ⭐️
Design, development and optimization of our data pipelines and architectures
Implement ETL processes and data integration from various sources
Collaborate with Data Analysts and Data Scientists to develop data-driven solutions
Ensuring the scalability, reliability and security of our data infrastructure
Monitor and improve data quality and availability
Actively participate in the ongoing development of our data strategy
Creating and maintaining technical documentation

Requirements

You’ll be great for this role if you have experience in 💪

This is what we think we’re looking for, but perhaps you have other skills that are a great fit for the role which we haven’t considered; we encourage you to still apply.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field
At least 3 years of professional experience as a data engineer or in a similar role
Strong knowledge of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL)
Experience with ETL tools and data integration processes
Knowledge of programming languages such as node.js or PHP
Understanding of cloud computing platforms (specifically GCP) and data warehousing concepts
Analytical thinking, problem-solving skills and a high level of initiative
Fluent in English; German language skills are a plus

Benefits

🥳
The opportunity to be part of an up-and-coming company with flat hierarchies and fast decision-making processes
Competitive salary and flexible working hours
Be part of a diverse team of PHP geeks, creative minds, database tamers, social media junkies and concept gurus - no matter where you're from, you're welcome to join us
Work single days from home or in one of our great, modern offices in Berlin or Madrid
Hardware you really want. Tell us your preferred equipment and we'll make it work.
Being part of a successfully growing company - Creative freedom, flat hierarchies and the opportunity to take on responsibility.
Well-equipped kitchen with free drinks (coffee, tea) and lots of tasty snacks (fruit).
Flexible working hours. Are you a night owl, day person or early riser? All are welcome.

Does this sound like your next challenge? Then send us your complete application in English in a PDF document including earliest start date and salary requirements! Your contact Sabine Sandig is looking forward to hearing from you!

job description:
About the job
Descripción de la empresa

¡Hola, somos Merkle! Una compañía especializada en Customer Experience Management, que forma parte del grupo global de comunicación dentsu.

Ayudamos a empresas IBEX35, grandes anunciantes y compañías Fortune 500 a desarrollar experiencias de clientes únicas y personales a través de los datos, la tecnología y la creatividad.

Poseemos capacidades únicas en Customer Experience, Data Management e Intelligence Analytics. Al tiempo que incorporamos la visión estratégica a nuestro alto grado de especialización creando una manera de trabajar única con nuestros clientes.

Con sede en Madrid, Barcelona y Gijón, la base del liderazgo de Merkle lo forman las personas. Un EQUIPO de TALENTO DIGITAL formado por profesionales con gran pasión, ilusión y potencial en su trabajo

Descripción del empleo

En MERKLE apostamos por aquellas personas a las que les gusta salir de zona de confort, que aspiran a encontrarse y superar nuevos retos y que quieren trabajar en un ambiente amigable y donde todos somos un equipo.

Buscamos personas motivadas, que se propongan retos y que se sientan cómodas trabajando en equipo y proponiendo nuevas formas de hacer las cosas. Personas que disfruten del trato con el cliente en un ambiente donde los datos nos rodean y la interpretación de los mismos es nuestro arte.

El perfil que estamos buscando tendrá como principales funciones:

Diseñar soluciones personalizadas de medición digital según requisitos del cliente.
Desarrollo de modelos estadísticos.
Validación y seguimiento de los modelos.
Elaboración de informes/dashboards de acuerdo a necesidades del cliente.
Colaborar con ingenieros de datos, desarrolladores y analistas de negocio para la puesta en producción y evolución de los modelos desarrollados.
Impartición de formaciones en remoto y presenciales.
Rigurosidad en la aplicación del método científico y la metodología de trabajo.
Formación continua en las tecnologías y disciplinas digitales de la industria.
Soporte al cliente.

Te ofrecemos un puesto de trabajo estable, de futuro, con posibilidad de promoción interna.

Trabajamos con clientes de primer nivel, empresas líderes en su sector con un alto grado de madurez digital.

Queremos que te sientas a gusto por lo que fomentamos actividades de cohesión interna para sentirnos más equipo.

Te daremos formación inicial y formación continua, aunque tu espíritu de buscar por ti mismo y tus ganas de aprender debe ser algo que marque tu desarrollo profesional con nosotros.

Fomentamos los hábitos de vida saludables y por ello tendrás seguro médico privado pagado íntegramente por la empresa.

¿Te unes al equipo? Te esperamos!!

Requisitos

Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Informática, Física, Estadística.. se valorará de forma positiva haber cursado un postgrado o master relacionado con análisis de datos o ciencia de datos.

Conocimientos avanzados en SQL, Python, R.

Seria interesante que tuvieses conocimientos acerca de los principales servicios de Google Cloud Platform, Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, BigQuery..

Lo ideal es que tengas experiencia en modelos estadísticos, así como orientación al cliente y dotes comunicativas.

El nivel de inglés para nosotros es muy importante, por lo que es importante que sea alto.

Información adicional

Te ofrecemos:

Contrato indefinido
Excelente ambiente de trabajo
Seguro médico privado
Amplio número de días de vacaciones
Horario flexible
Horario de verano (3 meses)
Posibilidad de teletrabajar
Formación continua (Linkedin Learning, Merkle University, etc)
Clases de inglés

Merkle does not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience. At the point of application, the candidate must have the legal right to work in Spain as we are unable to sponsor visas at this time.

As part of our Diversity and Inclusion agenda, and as an Equal Opportunities employer, if you require reasonable adjustments during the selection process please engage directly with your Recruiter.
